column1: 143kph, full and swinging wide of off, he's happy to leave. Some nice shape though
140kph, angled into the thigh pad, it runs off the thigh behind square for a leg bye
139kph, hooping back and it nearly pins him lbw. Just gets a little inside edge. That swerved back down the line late. Great delivery
141kph, good length angled wide of off, he's happy to let this go
144kph, fuller, fourth stump line, he pushes an awkward drive towards mid off
143kph, very full, almost a yorker, a hint of shape, he jams the bat down and pushes it to mid on
137kph, good length, fifth stump line, he's back and across and leaving. Good carry to Paine
141kph, good length, a touch fuller, angled across the left-hander and he leaves
139kph, good length, much wider, angled across and again he leaves
139kph, good length, hits the top of the front pad as he's half forward, there's a half shout for lbw but it's way too high
138kph, angled down leg and it swings late away from a diving Paine! Four byes
136kph, good length, nips away and beats the edge as he prods forward
138kph, shorter on the hip, he's back and tucking it through square leg neatly for a couple
good length, angled wide of off, easy one to leave
141kph, angled wide of off, fuller, again it's not swinging back so no need to play
141kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves with ease again
141kph, back of a length, climbing, it comes off the sticker as he's knocks it down into the off side, he was squared up
143kph, very full and swinging down leg
good length, 140kph, angled across and he leaves
138kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and across to defend with the full face. Nice and compact defensive stroke
139kph, good length, fourth stump line, he's back and leaving nicely on length
136kph, bouncer, angled over leg, he ducks under it well
136kph, fuller length, fourth stump, he presses forward and defends with the full face
134kph, good length fourth stump line, he's happy to leave
141kph, back of a length, angled across and he leaves again
139kph, shorter length, rib high on off, he's back and defending riding the bounce and knocking it down
143kph. fuller outside off, he punches straight down the ground, straight of mid off with a nice check drive for two
143kph, over-pitched, he drives nicely again, straight of mid off, even better timing as it wasn't as full, Wade had a long chase and just got there
140kph, shorter length, nipping back in, it comes off thigh pad
back of a length, on leg, he's back and working this the gap at midwicket for a single
139kph, good length, fifth stump line angled across and he leaves
138kph, good length, top of middle, he pushes on the front foot, working it wide of mid on

139kph, back of a length, wide of off, he's squared up in defence, it comes off the thick edge and runs along the ground wide of gully, Warner has a chase to the short boundary and he hauls it in with a diving save
134kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
138kph and a waft and miss! Poor shot. Full wide outswinger, feet were nowhere and he puked at it away from his body and missed it. Paine was interested in an edge but no one else went up
136kph, good length wide of off, he's leaving wide of off
140kph, full wide of off, he jams the bat down in defence. Wasn't pretty but he blunted it
140kph, bouncer, well side of off, he sways inside it. He could have stood there and no bothered. It was wide
139kph, angled into the hip, he's back and tucking this easily behind square
142kph, fuller angled into off, he feet are anchored but he slices a drive through cover-point
141kph, bouncer, high over middle, he ducks under it
142kph, good length shaping back and it takes him on the thigh pad
139kph, good length angled across, he leaves
138kph, good length, leg stump, it comes off the thigh pad and runs behind square for a leg bye
huge lbw appeal, not out. No review after a brief discussion between Paine and Hazlewood. Good length, straight, he shuffles across and it hits him too high. Hawkeye had it going over
half volley leg stump, he punches a lovely on drive wide of mid on! Superb stroke. Timing, balance, elegance
good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
134kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves it alone
133kph, short into the hip, he's back and across and glancing this to fine leg
138kph, over-pitched, he leans forward and pushes without timing through cover
138kph, good length angled across, well wide of off, he leaves this alone
138kph, back of a length, leg stump, it takes him on the thigh pad
138kph, back of a length, top of off, he's defending from the crease
139kph, good length, top of middle, he defends from the crease to short leg
136kph, good length, way wide of off, he's happy to leave
136kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and across and working this to square leg
136kph, shorter outside off, he jumps back and squirts a thick edge down just short of gully
135kph, good length wide of off, he leaves again
over-steps, good length wide of off, he leaves
137kph, good length, angled into off, he defends from the crease, getting in behind it with the full face
134kph, slightly fuller, wide of off, good stride and a nice push through the gap at cover
139kph, fuller outside off, he drives but drags it with the bottom hand to mid on
138kph, bouncer, high over off, he ducks under it easily
143kph, good length, fourth stump line, he's pressing forward and defending with the full face
143kph, very full outside off, he jams the bat down and blocks it back to the bowler
142kph, fuller, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
141kph, full, fourth stump line, he drives with a strong bottom hand dragging it to mid on
full on leg stump, he whips this through midwicket, they push hard and get back for two
87kph, tossed up outside off, he clips this with the turn to mid on
86kph, good length and shape on off, he defends on the front foot. Not much turn
88kph, wider of off, he's reaching out to defend with bat close to pad
tossed up higher outside off, he working this with the turn to mid on
wide of the crease, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
138kph, short ball, climbing and angled in, he's jumping and defending awkwardly to knock it down. The bounce and angled was a problem there
good length, angled in but shaping away, it's wide enough to leave
138kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he's back and across to defend to point
136kph, bouncer, over leg, he's ducking under it well
138kph, fuller, shaping into off, he punches nicely with the full face to mid on
137kph, over-pitched, he drives nicely, not quite timed, but he gets it wide of mid off
Azhar comes down the track, but ends up driving back to the bowler
flicked away to deep midwicket. Azhar growing in confidence now
defended from just outside off stump
nice shape on that ball. Bit of turn from middle, Shan stout in defence
pushes Shan onto the back foot. Good, tight over from Lyon
copy and paste. Just one from that one
Wide of off stump and short. Nothing to trouble Azhar, who shoulders arms
better, this one was angling back in. Good leave, though
pokes at one to point. Cummins needs to make Azhar play at more deliveries
fuller, brings Azhar onto the front foot for a defensive drive
bouncer, but going well down legside. Azhar ducks
well wide of off again. Maiden over, but not too much to get excited about
pitched around off, Shan defends to the offside
good bowling from Lyon. Not too short but not full enough to allow Shan to come onto the front foot
he's getting a bit of turn, but the batsman solid in defence
excellent delivery. Bit quicker and fuller, but Shan not quite certain about his footwork
and again. Something's happening here. This one dind't quite turn and Shan nearly regretted his leave. Bit of bounce, too
And Shan has the last laugh. Dropped this one short and Shan wastes no time in slashing this through backward point. Pakistan playing sensibly
good stump-to-stump line. Azhar blocks
full and straight, defended on the front foot
Cummins keeps dragging his length wide of off stump. Azhar watches it go through to Paine
outside off again, Azhar allows it to go through
seamed back in slightly, Azhar can still afford not to hit it
thick outside edge, goes through to slips on the bounce. Another maiden from Cummins
fuller and straighter. No spin there, and the batsman gets a thick inside edge on it
blocked
defended solidly
poked at it, only getting an outside edge and prompting some exited yelping from the keeper
lazy footwork from Shan. Stepped back but didn't quite commit to the shot. Thick inside edge onto his pad
better defensive work from the batsman. Two maidens on the trot
sharp bouncer around 140kph. Azhar spots it early and wants nothing to do with it
short and wide, Azhar defends to the offside
driven to mid-on
that's the line Cummins needs to be more consistent with. Targeting top of off. Azhar is up to this one, but some of the bowling from the world's best quick has been a bit wayward
brilliant again. Alert leave from Azhar but if Cummins sticks to this line, he's going to make it tricky for these openers
prodded just wide of mid-on, and Azhar keeps the strike. First run in 18 balls
bang on the money to start his second spell. Targets off and middle

oooh, was there an edge there? No, but that was superb stuff. Just short of a length and absolutely reared from the surface. Azhar lucky to miss that. This is what makes the Gabba such adifficult place to bat
follows it up with a toe-crusher. Azhar keeps his eyes on it, just about digging it out from underneath his shoelaces. Good, absorbing cricket
and a glorious straight drive to follow that drama. Went a little too full with that one, and Azhar is able to get out onto his front foot and caress it back past the bowler
hits him on the pad. Muffled appeal, but always too high and going down leg side
lets it go. Fascinating over
Starc begins with a full delivery. Not quite a yorker, though that's probably what he was going for
what happened there? Shan flicked it smartly behind square and instinctively set off for a run, without quite realising there was a leg slip stationed there
left alone
good line and length. No real movement, which is where these openers have perhaps made things easier for themselves
short, jabbed through the onside
good pace from Starc. Well defended. Maiden over. Australia ensuring Pakistan don't get away even if they aren't losing wickets
short. Didn't seem short enough to duck but Azhar does so anyway
dragged down legside
Hazlewood is getting a but of movement back into the right hander. Azhar up to it, though
good delivery, just outside off. Azhar blocks
slightly further outside off, a length Azhar has happily left to all morning
flicked off the pad for one. The legbye the only run of that over
Starc finds a bit of swing. Full delivery starting well outside off stump that comes back slightly
shorter and straighter this time, Azhar defends to short midwicket
fuller again from Starc. Azhar digs it out. A yorker at the stumps could be imminent
another short delivery. Azhar gets out of the way
sends that down legside
Slightly outside off and Azhar leaves it again. Can't say he hasn't judged line well, to be fair to him
pins Shan back with a bouncer to start off the over
fuller, targeted at off stump. Slightly wide of it, though, and Shan decides against playing it
deftly played through the onside. Sharp fielding from Cummins to keep it to one
blocked
nicely driven through the covers
another good-looking drive, this time to mid-on. One off the over
starts off with a bouncer. But even Australia's bouncers haven't been particularly well directed. Need to do better.
full from Starc, but dragged down the legside, and Shan whips it behind square leg. Goes all the way for four
shorter and straighter, defended. All movement has been drained from the ball now
wider of off, left alone
targeting off stump, Shan on to ti quickly to block
good delivery to end the over. Masood gets a thick outside edge to gully
lovely straight drive. A little more on that and it would have beaten mid-on to go all the way to four
bouncer, but Hazlewood hasn't quite got the pace to harass Azhar, who has enough time to let it go
wobbled in the air slightly, but Azhar gets in a solid block

driven through the covers gorgeously. Pakistan bring up the 50. It's taken pretty much the entire first session, but they've done it without losing a wicket, and that is a resounding success, no matter how sluggishly you might feel they've batted
fuller length, punched to mid-off. Azhar is getting comfortable now
makes Azhar jump with that one. A little shorter and quicker, hits Azhar just about the groin.
poked away just past gully, and the batsman come back for two
Starc getting the pace up now. This one over 144, straight into the body
short and straight, pushes Shan back
dragged his length down legside slightly, and Shan tucks it away to fine leg for another couple. Good batting from Pakistan, this
defended
full, flicked away by Shan, but short leg ensures it doesn't go for any runs. And that is lunch
139kph, very full tailing in, hits the pad, there's a shout for lbw, but it was going down and it runs away for an extra
139kph, very full angled wide of off, he watches it go by
135kph, bouncer, he ducks under it pretty well
138kph, short ball, he pulls, gets a bottom edge onto thigh pad, it pops up but well wide of short leg
138kph, fuller on off, he drives with the full face pushing this to mid on
131kph, another bouncer, it loops way over his head as he ducks
136kph, good length, off stump line, he presses forward and defends with the full face back down the on side of the track
138kph, good length, wide of off, fifth stump line, easy leave for Azhar
139kph, fuller outside off, he drives but mistimes it, dragging it off the inside half of the bat to mid on
magnificent on drive! This was overpitched angled into off, he got in a pristine position to drive it straight of mid on. Glorious
139kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends from the crease
139kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
132kph, back of a length angled into middle, he's back and tucking this behind square
133kph, back of a length outside off, he's squared up a touch but defends off the back foot

edged and it runs between second and gully. Good length, 132kph, it climbs from a length, he was forward, it caught the shoulder of the bat, but he had soft hands, it went straight down and between second and gully along the ground to the third man rope
140kph, good length, well wide of off, he leaves it alone
135kph, back of a length, top of off, he's standing tall and defending with the full face
133kph, bouncer, he ducks under it easily
137kph, back of a length angled in, he defends from the crease
139kph, back of a length, he's back and defending to mid off
139kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves
141kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it
just wide of short leg! 139kph, short ball into the ribs, he jumps back and fends it away off the gloves, it just loops behind square away from the diving Labuschagne who was infront of square
133kph, back of a length outside off, he's hanging back but defends well enough. It was tentative
an appeal for caught behind, not out, and no review. Back of a length, nipping in, it cut him in half as he defended and it went past the inside edge and flicked the back pocket through to Paine
136kph, good length wide of off, he's happy to leave
133kph, back of a length wide of off, it jagged away but he leaves
135kph, fuller, he squirts a drive off a thick outside edge behind point, this really races away over the outfield, Warner does well to haul it in
137kph, good length angled into off, he pushes this with the angle wide of mid on and runs with the stroke
140kph, fuller on off, he drives on the up to mid off
137kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working to mid on, he calls for a run but Azhar sends him back wisely
138kph bouncer, he ducks underneath it
141kph, good length angled into off, he defends with a compact position under his eyes

edged straight through a vacant fourth! It was at a catchable height but only two slips are in. A nothing shot from Shan Masood. Back of a length wide of off, he prodded at it, edged it like catching practice but no one was there
bouncer, over leg, he ducks underneath

caught at second slip! Got him this time! Back of a length, angled in and climbing, Masood was uncomfortable on the back foot, working across the line, closing the face, it comes off the edge and flies to second slip and Smith pouches the catch comfortably.
huge appeal for lbw but there was a clear inside edge. Good length, fuller, he pushes on the front foot and gets a thick edge onto pad. It was high too.

edged and caught at first slip! Brilliant catch from Burns diving forward. Superb bowling. Again that probing length and line, on a fourth stump, Azhar has to play, it nips away this time, catches the edge near the stickers and it flies low to first slip, Burns dives forward and gets his hands underneath it. Great take.
135kph, good length, fourth stump, he's in behind it defending with a full face and soft hands
134kph, fuller outside off, he's forward and driving without timing to mid off
back of a length outside off, he's prodding with soft hands, it comes off the edge and runs along the ground to gully
back of a length wide of off, he raises the bat above his head
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, he pushes on the front foot to cover-point
139kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending off the back foot
142kph, bouncer, he ducks under easily
141kph, good length wide of off, he leaves
138kph, bouncer, he ducks under it easily
139kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot with firm hands to mid off
134kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending to cover
133kph, back of a length, he's back and defending, knocking this down to his feet
good length, fifth stump line, he pushes on the front foot with an open bat face running it to point
134kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and turning this around the corner to fine leg
play and miss. 136kph, good length angled across him wide off, absolutely no need to go near this yet he tries to drive on the up and is beaten
135kph, good length across the left hander and he leaves wisely this time
136kph, back of a length top of off, he's back and defending
139kph, fuller outside off, he checks his drive, he's through it a touch early, dragging this to mid on
141kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it easily
146kph, good length, fourth stump, he's forward and defending off the sticker of the bat
141kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
141kph, good length off stump, he pushes towards mid on and Starc makes a good diving stop
134kph, back of a length outside off, he stands tall and defends to point
135kph, bouncer, over off, he ducks under it well
134kph, good length top of off, he defends with the full face on the front foot
136kph, good length off, stump, he presses forward and gets a thick inside edge to fine leg to get off the mark
135kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
133kph, fuller length targeting off stump, he defends with soft hands on the front foot
140kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends towards point
142kph, good length, angled in to off, he defends with the full face

caught behind! Too easy. 143kph back of a length well wide of off, he doesn't need to play, no footwork, he stands up and plays with the vertical bat away from the body, gets a thin edge and it's an easy catch for Paine!
short outside off stump, begins with a confident cut shot
a snorter under the armpit, and Babar just about fends it away. He's off
full, wobbled in the air slightly, but Asad confidently drives through the covers.
short and straight, Babar defends through the offside

disaster! catastrophe for Pakistan! Babar falls in the most un-Babar fashion you could imagine. Full and wide, and Babar launched into an expansive drive fourth ball into his innings. Got a juicy edge that flew to the slips, where Burns completed a comfortable catch
targeting the stumps, defended
expansive drive from Iftikhar. Almost looked like a T20 shot, caused a ripple of excitement among the crowd. Straight to the fielder. Is this how Iftikhar will play, then?
short and wide, lets it go
good delivery. What an over from Hazlewood. The wicket of Babar, and Australia are swarming all over Pakistan now
lets this go
some movement off the seam. Asad shoulders arms. He is so, so crucial to this innings now
gorgeously driven. Exquisite transfer of weight through his body and into the off-drive. It's a teaser for the fielder, and the batsmen run three
mean bouncer, and Starc follows it up with an extravagant follow-through. Iftikhar gets out of the way, but unlike some of the short stuff, this was very well-directed
Iftikhar shoulders arms. Starc honing in on that shorter length now
short again, Iftikhar ducks
short, and at the body. Blocked
much too wide of off for any  batsmen to bother playing
sweetly driven by Shafiq. Punched back past the bowler; it was all timing that created that shot. Perfect balance, rock-solid technique, ideal result
bang on off stump, defended
careful! Caught in two minds, there, was Asad. Not sure whether to play or leave. Did neither in the end, the ball taking the outside edge and keeping third slip interested for a while.
lovely ball to end a probing over. Just beats the outside edge
wicket-to-wicket, straight bat from Iftikhar
short. Starc appears to believe this is the stuff to discomfit Iftikhar. Interesting battle brewing here
short again, watches it go by
finds the gap through an empty gully. Deft back foot punch, and three further runs added
flicked confidently away through the onside for a couple. Shafiq, and how often do we say this, looking good
full, but kept out
driven back to the bowler, slightly uppishly
good length, defended through the offside
dead bat to a straight delivery
banged in short. Iftikhar is being peppered with this length right now. Gets out of the way

driven on the up. Maybe that's why they're bowling short to him. Went fuller this time, and Iftikhar had no qualms about stepping out to greet the ball and dismiss it through cover point. One of the best shots of the day
defends deftly to end the over
wide outside off, Paine collects
copy and paste. But of extra bounce once it was past the stumps, though
three in a row. Shafiq appears to steer clear of anything from Starc he doesn't need to play right now
yorker length, driven to mid-off
came back in slightly, defended confidently
swing! Came back in much more sharply and beat Shafiq on the inside edge. Hits his pads, though much too high for any real excitement

Lyon strikes first ball! Pretty careless from the batsman. Steps out to defend in front of his body, gets a thick inside edge onto his pad, and short leg is standing to gleefully pouch the easiest catch. Soft, soft dismissal. Australia insurgent
nice flight, dead-batted
and again. Rizwan keen to play much closer to his body.
driven back to the bowler. Somewhat uppish, excitement from behind the stumps
defended through the offside
manages to keep it down, so Labuschagne can't get into the game. Fantastic first over post-lunch from Lyon
that might be the shot of the day. Bit of width on offer and he leans into another silky cover drive. Teases David Warner in the chase, but trickles over the fence
whipped down to fine leg
leaves that one alone
punched through the offside to get himself off the mark
mean bouncer. Rearing up sharply, and Rizwan was reduced to taking evasive action while mid-air
strong finish to the over. Another short ball, hits Rizwan high up on the bat
once again, Asad lulled into an expansive shot through the offside, and just about avoids getting a tickle on it
nice line and pace. rizwan goes deep inside his crease and defends
shorter, allowing the batsman to male room for himself and carve it through point. Sharp fielding on the boundary keeps it to three
defended. Lyon is in his element now
Loss of concentration there, somewhat. Went for a cut, lucky not to get a feather on that
strong back foot punch, but it goes to a fielder
starts off with an excellent short delivery, has Rizwan jumping inside his crease
good-looking drive through the vacant cover-point region again
squared him up with one that threatened the stumps at pace. Just about gets his footwork right to keep it out
drags it down legside, gets some pad on it and it races all the way to fine leg. Any runs will do for Pakistan
sharp fielding at backward point once more. Lyon this time. Saves at least a couple of runs
thick edge down to mid-on
solid defence
confident! Comes down the wicket and flicks it in the air to midwicket. Gets a single, but he's taking risks all of a sudden. Not sure it's necessary
defended
that's one way of easing the pressure! Gets to the pitch of the ball, makes the cleanest contact and sees it clear the long-on boundary for the first maximum of the day
dead-bats this one sensibly. Eventful over
short of a length, Shafiq gets that defensive block out again
nicely directed bouncer. Shafiq gets out of the way
goes wider of the crease to change the angle and directs it at the stumps. Blocked
back-foot punch, and the pair scamper a quick single
magnificent shot from Rizwan. Perfect balance, allows the ball to get right to him, and when it's just underneath his eyes, just prods at it back past the bowler
four more! A little more ungainly, this, but just as effective. Short ball, and Rizwan goes back in his crease and whacks it through square leg. Nice little partnership building now
moves out of his crease, flicked to midwicket
straighter delivery. Shafiq stays put this time and defends it
once more. He's playing the ball late, which is the best way to handle Lyon
jabbed to the onside. Keeps it low
around the wicket, and it nearly produces instant results. Shafiq lost his balance slightly, and the extra bounce nearly claimed the edge of the bat
defended, and that brings about as good a session as Justin Langer could have dreamed of
136kph, half volley on leg stump and Rizwan clips is away beautifully! Lovely shot. But a surprisingly poor delivery.
135kph, fuller length wide of off, he pushes with hard hands and it runs through backward point and races away! Amazing timing
136kph, good length, top of off, he's defending from the crease to cover
glorious on drive! Three in the over. Over-pitched angled into off, and drives powerfully with the full face crunching it straight of mid on. Superb intent
138kph, short ball, chest high, he swivels on a pull and nails it straight to deep square leg
136kph, climbing outside off, he rides the bounce and knocks it down with his bat away from his body
139kph, fuller and a hint of shape back towards off, he makes a tight leave. That wasn't far away but a good leave in the end
135kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot. Lovely stride forward and plays under his eyes
132kph, back of a length, top of off, he's up on his toes to defend

edged between gully and second slip. Deep square went back, he was caught on the crease thinking it would be short, he hung back to a length ball, wafted wide of off, got an edge, it went down and through the gap
133kph, back of a length outside off, he stands tall and punches through point, they look for two but only get on as deep point as back
133kph, fuller length, angled in towards off, he defends on the front foot
139kph, bouncer, over leg stump, he ducks under it

caught behind! Oh dear! Almost a mirror image of Haris. 138kph back of a length outside off, he wafted with no footwork and he gets a thin edge to Paine. But replays show Cummins hasn't got any part of his foot behind the line! It's close but it looks like a no ball. No he's given out! What?! I have no idea what part of his boot was behind the line. I must be watching something different
142kph, angled into leg, he clips this nicely to fine leg
137kph, shorter length outside off, he's back and defending this with soft hands
137kph, good length well wide of off, he leaves this alone
137kph, good length outside off, he leans forward and defends towards point
beaten by a 133kph cracker. It wobbled in, he drove hard on the walk forward and missed as it nipped away
132kph beaten again. This is wider, good length, he pushes on the front foot again and misses
135kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and pushing to point
135kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
135kph, back of a length outside off, he's defending and pushing in defence away from his body
136kph, fuller on off, he clips this towards mid on and Starc misfields, it goes through him, they will run three
138kph, wide of off, fuller length, he drives expansively at it but misses
137kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot to mid on
136kph, short and wide and Yasir tucks in, nailing a cut shot behind point. Good shot
142kph, back of a length, top of off, he's jumping back and defending to mid on
a bouncer, outside off, he ducks it
another bouncer, and he sways inside the line
hip high short ball, he gets the knee up and plays a nice pull shot with control through midwicket for an easy three
139kph, fuller length, he drives, open chested but straight to mid off
130kph, bouncer, over leg, he ducks under it
130kph, good length, wide of off, nipping away and he leaves holding the pose!
131kph, good length wide of off, again he leaves it alone with a flourish
132kph, good length on off, he works this to short leg but he knocks it down
138kph, good length fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot in a compact position
136kph, good length angled into the top of off, he defends on the front foot to mid on

141kph, good length, angled into the top of off, he works this with the angle off the front foot wide of mid on
89kph, tossed up, drifting into off, he drives to mid off
good length leg break, a touch of turn, he smothers the spin
tossed up fuller, he drives firmly, but Azhar jumps up at cover and knocks it down
86kph, fuller and wider, he drives opening the face to place it through point to the sweeper
fuller outside off, he drives nicely against the turn through cover
a reverse sweep, it goes straight through Asad Shafiq at slip, he had his hands there and it burst through, it wasn't a chance as it was along the ground
138kph, bouncer angled over leg, he ducks under it
139kph, shorter length outside off, he chops it off the inside edge into pitch and it bounces straight up
139kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot to mid off
140kph, good length, well wide of off, he watchfully leaves
142kph back of a length outside off, he's back and punching it to point
139kph, bouncer outside off, he ducks under it
flatter leg break, straighter on middle, he's back and jamming down in defence
86kph, fuller on fourth stump line, he drives to mid off who is very deep
looped up outside off, he stretches forward to defend
shorter and quicker, he's back and covering up in defence
89kph, quicker leg break, he's working this with the spin through midwicket
88kph, slider on off, Burns takes a risk to work against the spin by turning his wrists to work to deep mid on
142kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working wide of mid on
nearly chopped on! Wasn't far away. 142kph back of a length, he doesn't move his feet, jabs at it, gets a thick bottom edge than runs behind him but wide of off stump
140kph, shorter length on off, he's back and tucking this behind square
145kph, fuller outside off, he gets a good stride in to defend with soft hands
141kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends in a superb compact position
142kph, yorker length angled into off, he stays deep in the crease to dig this out
shorter length, he's back and giving room to punch to a gap at cover-point
shorter length, he's back and cutting neatly to deep point
looped up outside off, he stretches out and defends off the middle of the bat
skipping down and driving inside out past mid off! What a shot. Superb footwork and hands to get it inside out past mid off with unreal timing along the ground.
good length leg break, he's defend from the crease
fuller and straight, he drives with ease to deep mid on for a single
141kph, back of a length, outside off, he stays leg side and pushes this with an open blade just past gully, nicely placed, Warner sprints two as the sweeper comes around
140kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
139kph, good length fifth stump line, he leaves again

138kph, good length, outside off, he defends on the front foot to cover-point, it's a late call for a run, Burns is struggling but the fielder didn't quite gather cleanly and the throw was awkward and wide
140kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
142kph, fuller on off, he works this on the up to mid on and they take on Azhar, he was slow to move and they sneak through
full, driven to mid-on
comes down the crease and crunches that to mid-off. Burns looks a lot freer now
uses his feet nicely to guide that to mid-on
bowls outside off stump, defends
a shade more flight, blocked
no timing there, was in the air for a while. Just about clears mid-on, nowhere near the middle of the bat. Australia getting all the lucky breaks, too
angling away from off stump

beauty, that. That's the angle he's been going for. Shaping away from the left-hander's off stump. Shaping away from the leftie all the while, and for the first time, Warner nudges at it uncertainly. A whisker away from the outside edge
whips this one off his pads to midwicket deftly to come back for two
shaping away again, this time Warner pragmatically shoulders arms
driven to mid-on, wonder about a single, but Azhar is sharply onto it
half-volley. That was there to be driven through the covers, but timing lets Warner down
short, cut to point
flight and turn there. Bit more pace on that
short leg looked like he might be in business there. Was in the air for the smallest amount of time on the onside
padded away to Shan Masood at short leg again
good delivery. Squares Warner up, who offers a defensive bat
driven back to Yasir. Decent over
hint of inward movement. Gets the inside edge of the bat wide long-on and the single brings up the 150
well wide of off
angling away. Imran is bowling slightly better of late. Keeps threatening that outside edge
short, pounced upon by Warner who creams a pull shot to deep midwicket. Good work on the boundary, where the fielder dives to his left to save four
exquisite. Princely. A bit too full, and Warner leans into the off drive. Just leans into the shot, brilliant transfer of weight that finds the gap around extra cover and rockets away to the fence
leaves that one alone
short ball, holds its line. Burns almost done by the lack of bounce
more assured this time, flicked down to fine leg giving the infielder a bit of a workout for the chase
pushed down to deep cover. Fielder actually hits the stumps from the throw, the ball clattering into Warner's, ummm, groin. He's okay, though
blocked

poor cricket all around. Bad delivery, really, well outside leg stump and spinning away. Warner got down on one knee and clobbered it to fine leg, where the infielder just saw it slip through his fingers, the ball going all the way to the fence
keeps a strike with a run on the offside. Another good over for Australia, yielding eight
watches it go through to the keeper
thick inside edge and the single takes David Warner to 90. 5 runs short of his entire haul in the Ashes this year
fuller, dead-batted
targeting the stumps, driven smartly to mid-on
another crisp drive, straighter this time. Doesn't quite beat the man at mid-on, though
short, gets out of the way
sliced through the offside. They settle for just the single
round the wicket. Bowled down leg side. Lucky not to be punished
flicked to the legside. Good work from the fielder keeps it to one
cut away to deep point
beautiful footwork and wristwork from Joe Burns. Comes down the track and lofts him over midoff into a vacant outfield. Skips away for four
and another one. This is too easy for Australia. This one on the onside. Well controlled behind square, where Burns times this into a gap. 11 off the Iftikhar over
begins with a half-volley, which Warner clobbers through the offside. Straight to a man, though
full on off-stump. Burns gets onto the front foot and rives through the covers
good, probing off-stump line, Burns offers a defensive dead-bat
opens the face of the bat to run it wide of backward point
driven to mid-off
decent first comeback over. Just two from it
flicked to the onside

worked away to midwicket, is that a run-out?. They came back for a risky two, and it was a direct hit that looked like it had Warner struggling. Looks like he's just about got in, but that was too close for comfort. Inches in this. That was Yasir Shah with the direct hit from the deep. Excellent work from him, even if he's just missed out on sending Warner back to the pavilion
short on leg stump, helped away down to fine leg
length delivery, Warner offers a straight bat
defended
pushes him onto the backfoot, thick outside edge to short third. Better over from Iftikhar
shaping away, but beginning wide of off stump. Burns not inclined to engage

beautiful straight drive, There was no mid-on and the temptation to time it back past the bowler was always there. No margin for error, and Naseem overpitched slightly. Burns nailed that shot to perfection.
goes back to the wider line. Burns watches it through to Rizwan
sharp bouncer, Burns had to  fend away uncertainly at that. Very well-directed, and reared up at the batsman very quickly
back of a length again, but Warner smartly deflects it down to third man. That's 95 for Warner, the amount of runs he got in the entire Ashes series.
keeps the strike after dropping it down through the offside. Warner four runs away from three figures
defended
blocked
dead bats it again
worked down to long-on. Warner a little more cautious now than he might have been if he wasn't bearing down on a much-awaited hundred like this one
flicked to short midwicket
blocked back to the bowler.
swivel-pulls it to mid-on. Thought he might have got it either side of him for a fraction
driven to mid-off. Can't get it through that gap, though
worked through the onside. Moves to 98. Burns on strike with three balls remaining. Looks like three figures may have to wait after tea, after all
majestic drive through the covers. Doesn't go all the way for four. Just leant into it and gave the already knackered fielders another long chase just before tea
good delivery. Bang on off stump. Warner's not inclined to take any chances, and why would he?

oh, there was nearly a mic-up as Warner sought that hundred. Pushed it into the offside and they absolutely sprinted the first one. Burns was ready to come back, but Warner thought with his head in a pressure moment and opted against risking it. He will sip tea on 99
133kph, good length tempter way wide of off and he watches all the way through to the keeper without offering
135kph, back of a length, sixth stump line, he leaves again
135kph, fuller wide of off, he checks a drive ... straight to the man at cover
135kph, good length, he pushes half forward, off a thick outside edge, bouncing to backward point
135kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
138kph, good length wide of off, he leaves and the crowd groans
88kph shorter leg break, he's back and defending back to the bowler
shorter length on off, bouncing, he is back and giving room to punch to deep point
looped up leg break on off, he leans out and defends
shorter leg break, it spins sharply, he's jammed up trying to cut
fuller on middle, he checks his drive, knocking it to midwicket

shorter on the hip, there it is!He tucks it away through square. His trademark leap returns! He takes off his helmet, raises the bat to his mates. Burns gives him a hug. 22 Test centuries for Warner. His first for nearly two years.
135kph, good length on off, he defends on the back foot
over-steps and called. 134kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the back foot
top of off, angled into off, he's back and tucking this through midwicket, Burns wants two, Warner sends him back wisely
135kph, short and wide, he opts to leave
139kph, good length, fourth stump line, he presses forward and defends nicely
139kph, good length fifth stump line, he plays a rock solid forward defence again
137kph, over-pitched, he drives nicely and a misfield at cover allows a couple
short and wide and Warner is back and cutting beautifully through point! Superb stroke. Too short and wide. He was quick to pounce
tossed up on off, he's forward and defending
fuller on middle, he's driving with the turn to long on
quicker and shorter, on middle, he's back and forcing back down the pitch
looped up on middle, 85kph, he reached out and defended
91kph, fuller outside off, he defends on the front foot
good length, on off, he defends with the full face of the bat on the front foot
136kph, shorter length, he's back and playing a short arm pull, knocking it forward of square and they sprint for two as the man in the deep comes in
135kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot pushing to mid on
135kph, shorter wide of off, he's back and cutting but straight to the man at backward point
135kph, good length, fifth stump, tailing back a touch but he leaves watchfully
135kph, good length angled into off, he plays a rock solid defensive shot on the front foot
flatter and shorter on off, he exposes the stumps and places this cut behind point, there is a misfield but no two on offer
tossed very high, he drives inside out to wide mid off for an easy one
looped out wide of off, he reaches out and defends away from his body
83kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot
fuller on off, he works against the turn to deep mid on for an easy one
advances and lofts flat but it's straight of mid off! Powerful strike. He hit this check drive at waist height but mid off was too wide to get anywhere near it. It raced away
140kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending to cover
132kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he's back and defending
136kph, angled into off, he drives neatly to mid on
139kph, fuller length on off, he leans forward and drives to mid on again
136kph, full and wide, he drives beautifully on the up but picks out the man at cover
135kph, good length wide of off, he drives away from his body mistiming it to mid off
fuller and slower on middle, he checks a drive to long on
drifting into leg, he drives easily to long on
looped up on middle, he checks his drive back to the bowler, Yasir misfields but they wisely don't run
slider from the front of the hand on leg, he picks it and defends on the front foot
89kph, top spinner, he's back and forcing to cover
pushed through leg break on off, he defends
135kph, back of a length, outside off, he's back and forcing to point
120kph, slower ball, Burns spots it and defends back to the bowler
138kph, back of a length on a fourth stump line, he defends on the back foot
length ball, 133kph, wide of off, he thrashes a front foot square drive but straight to the fielder placed at wide third man
132kph, rising bouncer over leg stump, he ducks under it
134kph, fuller angled into off, he pushes a drive to mid on, doesn't time it which allows a single
shorter on leg, he's back and tucking this behind square for a single
looped up on off, he pushes to cover
flatter on middle, he's back and working this against the turn, weighting the shot to get to the big gap at midwicket, just beyond where the circle would be in ODIs and they run two
fuller outside off, he pushes a defensive prod to cover
played on around his legs! Burns gone three runs short of a century! The trap worked. A looping leg break outside leg, he gets down to sweep and drags a bottom edge onto leg stump! Burns is shattered
fuller on middle, he whips against the turn wide of mid on, Azhar misfields, a poor effort, and allows two
short and wide at 128kph, he stands up and slaps a cut past cover, the man in the deep comes around
125kph, good length, angled into off, he defends from the crease
128kph, half volley outside off, he drives nicely but straight to mid off
128kph, good length, wobbling wide of off, he leaves this alone
128kph, length ball angled well down the leg side
short ball, hip high, he's back and smoking a pull straight to the man at deep forward square
shorter leg break on off, he gives room to cut off the stumps to deep point
89kph, fuller outside off, he drives back to the bowler
short and wide, it sits up and he's back to punch this through cover into the gap for three
nicely shaped leg break on off, he defends on the front foot
sharp bounce from a length, beating the edge. Rizwan struggled to glove it
shorter length, he pulls from one knee around the corner to deep square
back of a length on off, he's back and defending to cover-point for a quick single. The fielder gathers and hits but Labuschagne is home easily
141kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he's back and defending to cover
141kph, back of a length on off, he stands tall and defends with ease
140kph, good length, fourth stump, he's back and dropping the bat on it in defence
138kph high short ball, he's waiting and pulls nicely infront of square, he didn't time it, but it's a long chase for Shaheen, he gets there, but they run four
137kph, short lifter outside off, he's back and rising with the bounce to knock it down
play and miss trying to cut a ball way too close to off and not short enough. Warner lost balance there
wrong un tossed up, he picks it and drives inside out to cover
looped up on leg, he skips down and whips this nicely through midwicket, Babar makes a diving stop to ensure it's only one
87kph, drifting in full on middle, he defends on the front foot
loped outside off, he drives on the up, cracking stroke but straight to mid off
drifting into off, he reaches out and defends with the full face
back of a length on off, he stays leg side and punches this straight to cover-point
142kph short and wide, he's back and cutting firmly to deep point
140kph, top of middle, he's back and clipping this to wide mid on
143kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
141kph, short and wider, he's back and cutting to deep backward point
139kph, short lifter outside off, he rises with the extra bounce and knocks it down
pitching outside leg, he's clipping this easily off his pads to deep square
drifting into leg, he whips firmly to midwicket, Azhar misfields but it bounces straight to mid on
90kph fast leg break on leg, he defends on the front foot
play and miss trying to drive a full ball. There was some turn and bounce outside off. Rizwan didn't take it cleanly
looped up outside off, he drives neatly to mid off
drifting into middle, he reaches out and defends
141kph, short and wide, he stands tall and hammers a cut to deep point
142kph, too full and straight, he clips this off the pads with ease to deep square
139kph, good length angled to middle, he gets in behind it to turn this midwicket, he pushes for a second but has to settle for one
141kph, good length wide off, he sits back and guides a late cut straight to gully on the bounce
142kph, good length, angled into off, he defends from the crease
140kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
coming in from around the wicket, Warner runs it down to third man
landed it on off, batsman blocks
drags this down, and punished accordingly. Labuschagne takes a step back, waits for it and dispatches it to the extra cover boundary
pitched on leg, worked away on the onside for one
short again. Pulled away, not very cleanly by Warner. Was uppish, and they come back for two
spinning in sharply, strikes Warner on the pads. Big appeal, but they decide against a review. Probably struck him outside off, to be fair
tidy enough start, pitching on off. Defended by Labuschagne
tries to cut this away, beaten for bounce. Rizwan collects, somewhat clumsily
driven to short extra
good delivery. Bit of turn, drift and bounce around off stump
uses his wrists to work it away to the onside
ends a fairly stellar first over
flighted on off stump, blocked
middle stump line this time, dead-batted
more of the same. Game might be entering a holding pattern for now
driven straight back
comes around the wicket now, operating around Labuschagne's leg stump
dropped short, batsman rocks back and clobbers this into the onside. Just the one from the over
brilliant delivery. Turn and bounce and nearly took the bats,an's edge. Haris doing well right now
thick outside edge to point
first real loosener. Low full toss, and Labuschagne deftly works it away to midwicket. Gets a boundary, relieves any pressure Pakistan might have been building
defended
off stump line, offers a straight bat to that
carved down to point
dances down the wicket, hits his pad and Warner has to scurry back to this crease
works it down to third man. Bit of turn on offer now, it appears
driven to midwicket
bit of turn again. Beats the batsman's outside edge, striking him on the body. Operating around the wicket, so lbw not really in the game
defended
swivels to clatter it down to the square leg boundary. Protection there, though. Yasir looking slightly more menacing to both batsman from this angle
lands on middle stump, blocked
jabbed to the onside, and the pair change ends
flicked to the onside
uses his feet, works it to long-on and ambles through for one
straight back to the bowler
cut sharply to beat the man at backward point, fielder on the boundary mops up
rocks back and slices it through the offside. Yasir back over the wicket
nice flight and drift. good work to cut the straight drive off, too
lands on middle defended
continues to chip away at that off stump, Labuschagne opens the bat and works it away to the offside
good delivery around off. Blocked
driven to extra cover. Ends a decent over
high full toss, gets away with it
full on leg stump, eased down to long on
they shuffle through for one. Far too easy for Australia

down leg stump, and Warner missed a chance to dispatch it to the boundary. They are reviewing. Seemed nothing in that, but Rizwan seems convinced there was bat. Let's listen in. Seems nothing in this. Yep, not out
driven crisply to mid-off
tickled down to fine leg. And that's sloppy from Naseem! Casual attempt to pick up with the left hand, took his eyes off it and it goes across for four. Soft runs given away there
driven back, Yasir throws it in frustration back at the keeper. Hits Labuschagne instead. Batsman takes it in good spirits. he's in a better mood than Yasir
worked away to the onside
better delivery. Drifted just outside off stump. Warner's thick outside edge fends it away
lands outside leg stump, padded away
thick inside edge. Was in the air for a while, but short leg couldn't really get involved
blocked
defended back to Haris
flicked away past mid-on
uses his feet to come down the ground and drives sweetly to extra cover, Bit of a chase. They pondered three, but stuck with two
fuller, carved down to deep backward point

chance there! Flew past the first slip. Looked like it had burst through his fingers, and goes away for four! Yes, that's pretty much what happened. Hard chance for Shafiq, but Pakistan need something brilliant to happen for them
defended
drives it down to mid-off
swept away for a boundary. A bit too full and a tad too predictable, Labuschagne got into position early and swivelled across to beat the two men on the boundary around square leg. Great shot
blocked
allows it to clatter into his pad. Rizwan appeals, it pitched outside leg, though
defended
defended
uses his feet, straight to the fielder at extra
lands on leg, defended
dead-bats it again
blocked agian. 2 balls till the new ball becomes available
runs it down to long-on
tidy over. New ball is available
no timing on that cut, Warner looks slightly annoyed with himself
lands outside off, coming in. Warner steps forward and blocks. Suddenly very circumspect, the opener
backfoot punch through the offside. Fielder has another draining chase, and Warner is now three runs from 150
flicked away to midwicket
opens the face of the bat, the cover fielder cuts it off
driven back to the bowler
languid prod to the onside
driven to mid-on, sharp running
defended down to fine leg
tickled away for one
driven to cover
lands on off stump. A bit of drift there
length delivery, punched to cover
nice sharp first ball with the new one. Just outside off stump. Warner wants nothing to do with it
beats the outside edge. Hasn't happened too often today. Swing on offer there. Warner lulled into driving, geaten by the movement
single for Warner, and that's his 150. Another wonderful innings from one of the world's best openers. Warner is well and truly raring to go this Aussie summer. The Ashes a distant memory already
straight, defensive bat
driven to mid-on
strays a little too far down leg, Warner jabs it down to square leg
lands outside off stump, Labuschagne shoulders arms
excellent shot. Beats backward point and there's no protection in the deep. Short and wide, batsman got in position very early and punches it down to the boundary
needs to bowl more at the stumps. Lands outside off, left alone
pierces the cover region, and they amble back for two. Naseem doesn't seem to be posing much of a threat. Has been a long, hard day for the youngster
late swing, Rizwan collects it well behind the stumps
beats Warner's inside edge. Straightened out instead of moving away, which is what deceived the opener
driven back to Shaheen, who collects smartly
moving away from Warner. He's poking at one or two he needn't. Will be livid with himself if he gets out in these closing stages
good delivery, more convincing in defence
thick inside edge. Probing over from Shaheen
maiden over
starts off with a gentle wide delivery. Labuschagne lets it go
driven to mid-off
better line. Targets top of off
well outside off, left alone
thick edge down to deep backward point

ooh, what a delivery that was! Clips the off stump without dislodging the bail. That deserved a wicket, to be honest. Swung back in sharply and hits off stump. As a bowler, you can't do much more than that
dragged down legside
sharp swing back into the batsman. Strong appeal from Shaheen, who wants a review. Azhar isn't inclined

low full toss, jabbed through the onside, and that brings up his half-century. Excellent innings from a man at the top of his game. Has hit a purple patch of late, and this innings was as assured as any of the others
timed straight down the ground
left alone
ends the day with an assured leave outside off stump
good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
128kph, good length shaping back in a touch, but it's wide enough of off for Warner to leave
128kph, back of a length, come swing come back towards off, he defends on the back foot
128kph, back of a length, sixth stump line, he leaves this alone
128kph, fuller and wider, he tries to square drive aggressively, gets a thick inside edge onto pad
131kph, good length, well wide of off, he leaves
132kph, fuller length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot

137kph, back of a length on off, he's squared up a touch in defence, gets a slight leading edge
136kph, back of a length climbing outside off, he jumps back and defends from a compact position
fuller on middle, he pushes it to mid on and Naseem is slow to respond, they pinch another single
138kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he leaves easily on length
129kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he defends off the back foot to mid off
fuller on off, he pushes a drive to mid off
130kph, good length, well wide of off, he leaves this alone
130kph, good length, well side of off, he watches it go by
130kph, good length, sixth stump line, he leaves again
132kph, fuller length, but wide again, he's not tempted to play
137kph, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot angling it to gully
magnificent straight drive! Over-pitched outside off, he climbs into a lovely drives dtraight back past Shaheen, straight of mid off. No need to run
137kph, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
135kph, over-pitched again and he caresses this through cover-point! Too much width, long half volley, he was down one knee to drive powerfully through the off side picking the gap
139kph, back of a length top of off, he's back and defending
137kph, chest high short ball, he swivels on a pull shot rolling it behind square to deep square
130kph, back of a length, outside off, he's back and defending
134kph, back of a length angled into off, he's back and defending with the full face
131kph, fuller length, fourth stump, he presses forward to defend
134kph, full and angled into middle and leg, he gets in a great position to clip this neatly wide of mid on with nice timing, they pick up three
good length, angled in from around the wicket, but it's wide enough to leave
129kph, back of a length, nipping in, it takes him on the thigh guard as he tried to work square on the leg side
135kph, bouncer, over off, he shapes to pull and then ducks under it
136kph, back of a length, top of off, he's squared up defending to backward point
137kph, wide of the crease, angled across but he's back and covering off in defence
137kph, chest high short ball, he's in position and nailing a pull shot forward of square, the sweeper is out there
136kph, fuller, he cracks a check drive back down the pitch and Shaheen knocks it down with the left hand
136kph, fuller on off, he mistimes a drive to mid off, they take on Azhar and beat the throw easily
133kph, angled into off from wide of the crease, he was looking to work across the line to midwicket but checked the stroke to defend with a slight leading edge
half tracker smashed for four! You cannot bowl there at the Gabba. 128kph, rib high short ball, Labuschagne had a week to rock back and smack it through midwicket
134kph, good length, wide of the crease angled in, but wide enough for him to leave
133kph, angled into the top of off, he works this to wide mid on for a single
128kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he's back and across and defending
130kph, slightly fuller, fourth stump, he leaves comfortably
a lazy play and miss. 138kph, back of a length, tight to off, he made a late decision to try and run it third man, it went past the inside edge and through to Rizwan
136kph, good length, nipping back he gets a thick edge onto pad but it bounces away safely to a vacant square leg and they run really well to pinch two
137kph good length, angled wider of off, he leaves
136kph, back of a length, angled wider of off, he leaves it alone
138kph, good length angled across wide of off, he leaves
