tossed up on off, he drives to cover
beaten pushing at a sharper spinning and bouncing leg break wide of off. Lovely delivery
nice leg break on middle, he defends from the crease reaching out
full again and again he drives beautifully inside out past cover, the sweeper is straighter so it's only two this time
87kph flatter on off, he defends
142kph, good length angled across, he leaves
140kph, back of a length, over off, he jumps back and defends well
139kph, angled into off from wide, he's back and tucking this to the gap at midwicket with soft hands
1142kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and defending to cover
beaten by a cracker! 141kph, back of a length, angled in, nipping away, zipping past the edge. What a seed.
142kph, fuller, but a good length stump, fourth stump, he defends on the front foot to cover
good length leg break, he's back and defending with soft hands
looped up slower, he reaches forward and defends
86kph, short of a length, he's back and forcing this to backward point
tossed up, he's forward and driving to cover
driving at one that drifts in, he gets a thick inside edge at loops safely wide of midwicket
flatter and quicker on leg, he's back and defending
141kph, good length wide of off, he's back and leaving this
147kph, back of a length, outside off, he's back and defending to cover
143kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he leaves on length
142kph, good length, a touch wider, he's able to leave again
144kph, good length fifth stump line, he leaves again extravagantly
143kph, fuller outside off, he drives but drags it off the inside half of the bat to mid on for a single
play and miss trying to cut a ball too close! This was pushed through quicker. It tempted him and it bounced a touch. Labuschagne was annoyed with himself
whipped magnificently against the spin through midwicket! What a shot. Great footwork and hands to place that in the gap at midwicket. Superb skill
looped up slower wide of off, he leaves
tossed up, he drives with the bottom hand to mid on who is deep but it was timed too well to get a single
shorter and he tries to guide this cut to get it fine but picks the fielder
good length, he's caught on the crease but defends it well

huge appeal for caught behind, not out. They went nuts think Warner had touched this wafting at a length ball. No review after a long discussion. Nothing on RTS. Good decision. Poor shot. His feet were nowhere and he just jabbed at it
beaten again driving at a fuller one on the up, just nipped away. Beautiful bowling
143kph, fuller and slightly wider, he's not tempted to play this time
141kph, fuller, on a fourth stump line, he strides out and pushes to cover

Got him! Caught behind off the bottom edge! Sensational bowling from Naseem! He deserved that. A brute of a short ball. Angled in and following him, he couldn't get out of the way, got a bottom edge as he tried to sway inside it, Rizwan dives low to his left and takes a great catch.
146kph full on off stump. Smith gets in line and defends. Naseem follows through. Cracking stuff
lands on middle, but of turn. Labuschagne blocks
tossed up wide of off stump, driven through the cover region
driven to extra cover, where Azhar fields sharply
draws Smith well out of his crease to offer a defensive stroke. Yasir is probing well at the moment
hit straight back to the bowler
excellent stuff. Turning from a middle stump line
goes back in his crease to drive to backward point
short of a length, Labuschagne defends
pulled down to cow corner, and Smith is back on strike
well directed bouncer, rearing up sharply. Smith ensures his head's out of its way
landing outside off, Smith leaves
left alone again. Just that single from the over
gets on the front foot to offer a straight, defensive bat

big appeal, given! Reviewed straightaway. Pitched around middle and off and the batsman appeared to play down the wrong line, getting beaten on the inside edge. Replays show a thick edge, however. This will be overturned. And it is
Back foot cut, and Shaheen lets it slip through his legs, getting Labuschagne off strike. Yasir is not happy
up and over, and Smith is away! Dances down the crease and just flicks it over midwicket for four

and he's cleaned up Smith's off stump! What happened there? landed on off, didn't even turn much. Smith tried to whip this through the onside, and just missed the ball completely. A sense of disbelief around the Gabba as Smith has a rare failure
in the air off Wade's inside edge. Kept Shan Masood interesting. Pakistan are prowling now
block and run. Shaheen has the chance to have a go at Wade now
good first ball. Just outside off Stump, and Wade shoulders arms
and again. Shaheen is trying to move it back in to the left-hander. Hasn't happened just yet, though
more assured front foot cover drive from Wade. Fuller delivery, too, and Wade gets him off the mark
pulled down to midwicket. Shaheen not quite quick enough to get much bounce from the short delivery right now
short of a length outside off
slightly loose from Yasir. A bit short and the batsman whips this through the onside and gets off strike
wrong'un, and if Pakistan had a silly mid-off, that would have been an easy catch. Pops up in the air on the offside from the edge
defended on the front foot
pushes him back inside his crease. Wade dead-bats it
lovely shot, this will do him the world of good. Much too full outside off, and Wade pounces on it in a flash, tonking it through extra cover
driven to mid-off
short and wide, angling across Labuschagne. He doesn't play it
and again. Pakistan might prey on his nervousness as he approaches his first Test century.
driven crisply back to the bowler

and that's it, his first Test hundred! Bit of luck with the final shot, but boy, has he deserved that! Thick outside edge that pieces the gap where Pakistan decided against having a fourth slip. He kisses the badge, embraces Wade and acknowledges the crowd and his family. Love moment
back to business with a cautious leave outside off stump
blocked on the back foot
and lashed over mid-on from Wade. Uses his feet to get to the pitch and takes the aerial route. Commanding stroke
defended
lands outside off stump, blocked on the front foot
defended
uses his feet and just about ensures he gets some bat on it
solid defence to end the over
drives back to the bowler
angling across the stumps. Labuschagne leaves it again
defended to mid-on
crisp drive back to Shaheen. Labuschagne looks very comfortable. Shaheen not really getting any movement, and not looking too menacing
as I say that, he draws a thick outside edge from the batsman again. Slower delivery he leant into and just bounced in front of the gully fielder. Good thinking from Shaheen
rocks back and blocks. Maiden over
googly, but drops it a bit short and Wade is on to it. Square cuts it and gives a couple of Pakistan fielders another draining chase. The ball wins
gets on the front foot, and a defensive block allows them to change ends
lands it outside off stump, defended
good ball. Lands on middle and turning towards off. Big stride from Labuschagne to block
defended again, but sharp backspin saw it nearly go back onto the stumps. Kicked away
thick edge to short third man. They ponder taking a single but it's never really on
driven through the covers
Wade lets Rizwan collect it
driven to mid-off
short ball, Wade gets out of the way
dropped into the vacant infield on the legside
dead-batted
lap sweeps it to fine leg, and this races down for four. Yasir looks frustrated, difficult to set a field for that, and this is the second time Wade has begun a Yasir over by smacking him for four
thick inside edge, but evades short leg
driven back to the bowler
copy and paste
inside edge onto the pad. Landed outside off stump and spinning sharply in. I think they need a silly mid-off. Enough has happened to justify it
single on the offside allows Wade to keep the strike
begins with a harmless delivery on middle and leg, guided down to square leg
drives against the turn to mid-off
front foot forward defensive shot
low full toss. Looked to whip this through midwicket, but Haris gets away with it
defended
forward defence again. Just the one that over
spinning sharply in from outside off, blocked
wristy stroke gets it through to deep square
shorter this time, allowing Labuschagne creams it through the offside
indecisive footwork, hits him on the pads. muffled appeal for lbw, but pitching outside leg
short. Poor delivery and Wade is so quick to rock back and slap it behind square for four. He's played Yasir very well in the past 20 minutes or so
single down to fine leg as Australia near 400
the lap sweep comes out again and fine leg has some work to do to cut if off on the boundary
off stump line, defended
well bowled, in that corridor of uncertainty where he wasn't sure whether to go forward to get back
driven back to the bowler
poked towards point
drive to cover, and that ends the first session
83kph, shorter length, he's back and punching to mid off who is very deep. Easy one
tossed up slower, he mistimes a drive back to Haris
very slow on off, he steps out to defend
flighted nicely, he skips down, short of the pitch and has to thrust the pad at it
84kph, pushed through flatter, he's back and defending
attempted reverse sweep, he nearly drags it on and it just runs past leg stump off the glove!
131kph, good length, angled from wide of off, but it's a fifth stump line, he leaves
130kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he shuffles back and across to knock it to midwicket
128kph, around the wicket, back of a length angled in, he's back and defending, turning it to the gap at midwicket for an easy single
130kph, fuller, angled into off, he drives fluently with a checked stroke, but hits it straight to mid on
132kph, wide of the crease, angled in half-volley, he whips from off stump to deep square
134kph, angled across the left hander, he leaves as it's well wide of off
tossed up on leg, he defends
short down leg, he's back and tucking this behind square
darted into leg stump, he's back and working this to backward square
85kph, pitching way outside leg, he paddle sweeps, it balloons off the top edge but safely lands well short of a wide fine leg
87kph, pushed through, he's back and defending
darted in, he's jumping down early but it's too short, he defends on the move
134kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and defending
130kph, fuller angled into off, he whips this to deep midwicket
132kph, angled across Wade, wide of off, he's happy to leave
129kph, good length angled across, no shape, he leaves this again
131kph, good length pushed even wider of off, Wade has zero interest in playing
131kph, fuller and wide of off, again, he leaves this alone once more
lovely paddle sweep and a misfield on the rope from Shaheen! This was fired down leg, he gets down early, paddles it fine, Shaheen runs from wide fine and gets there but can't knock it back
length ball, on leg, he's defending from the crease
fuller on leg, he whips this through midwicket to the man in the deep
89kph, fired from wide of the crease, he's caught on the crease, defending
tossed up on off, he reaches out and defends
too short and wide, he's back in a flash giving room and cutting very nicely through point, Shan Masood has a long chase and he just hauls it in. Good sliding save
131kph, shorter length and wide again, Wade jumped outside off early to counter the wide line, he defends, unable to work it to the vacant leg side
135kph, good length, angled way wide of off, Wade leaves again
133kph, good length well wide off, Wade trying not to get bored leaves again
133kph, straighter line on leg, Wade tucks this off the pads through midwicket, they run hard and get two
133kph, good length angled across, fourth stump, he leaves this alone
134kph, good length, angled across and he leaves once more
looped up on leg, he whips this from the crease to deep midwicket
down the track and launching it 10 rows back over long on! He jumped early and it was in the slot, he wasn't at the pitch but trusted there would be no spin, he absolutely smoked it
92kph, flatter outside off, he's pushing this cover
shorter length, he's back and standing tall to punch this past midwicket, wide of long, they run an easy two
drifting into off, he defends on the front foot
looped up, 80kph, he reaches out and defends
133kph, good length wide of off, fifth stump, he leaves
132kph, back of a length, angled into off, he defends from the crease
134kph, wide of the crease, fuller on off, he defends on the front foot in a perfect position
129kph, drag down short ball and he pulls it easily to fine leg and there is no fielder there! He just pulled it with the angle. Strange to have no fine leg with Imran's angle
shot of the match! A straight drive to savour! Over pitched fourth stump line, he drives straight through the line between the bowler and the stumps. He held the poise. Textbook straight drive
good length, top of off, he defends again
82kph, shorter on leg, he trues to flick it away off the hip, gets a thin inside edge onto thigh, it bounces up but well wide of the leg slip
tossed up wide of off, he flicks a cover drive in a Kohli type fashion but picks out the fielder
full on leg, he sweeps hard behind square, Shaheen dives awkwardly and knocks it away from himself and they run three
tossed up on leg, he sweeps fine off the top edge, it spins on the second bounce but Imran gets down
shorter on leg, he's back and dabbing this to square leg
85kph, shorter on leg, cramps him up as he works it to square leg
134kph, back of a length, angled across, he's back trying to work across the line, a slight leading edge that drops down on the off side
136kph, good length, on off, he defends towards the gap at midwicket
135kph, shorter length, it zips through, back off the seam, catches Wade on the thigh guard
137kph, back of a length angled into off, he's back and defending
Wade shuffles down early, Shaheen digs in a 132kph bouncer that flies over his head
135kph, bouncer, wide of off, he ducks easily
87kph, good length on off, he's back and punching back to the bowler
a hint of width, he's back and delicately dabbing a late cut fine, lovely touch for two
full drifting into leg, he whips this through midwicket with ease
tossed up, 86kph, wide of off, he drives neatly to cover
shorter on off, he's back and whipping this behind square, Shaheen didn't see it! He ran the wrong way before eventually spotting it!
shorter length on off, he's back and pushing this to cover
138kph, shorter length outside off, he's jumping back to punch this with a vertical bat to point
lovely square drive behind point! 139kph full and wide, he was in a great position to place this with power past point and it raced away
139kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across to defend
135kph, short of a length on off, he's back and tucking this midwicket for a single. 50 for Wade. Continues his fine run since returning to the Test side.
139kph, fuller angled into off, he plays a supreme on drive but straight to mid on
139kph, fuller, wide of off, he mistimes a drive to cover
looped up on middle, he defends on the front foot
looping leg break on middle, he works this with the spin to midwicket
tossed up outside off, he reaches out to paddle sweep fine, nicely controlled to rotate the strike
low full toss, he uses the bottom hand to works this square of midwicket, superb running to pinch a third on Shaheen's throw
premeditates the paddle sweep, it's shorter, but he controls it around the corner
lovely late cut! So well played. Wasn't that short or wide, he waited and waited and waited, and just knocked it past slip and it raced to the third man fence
137kph, good length, angled in, he's unsure defending on the front foot, gets an inside edge that runs through his legs for a single
135kph, short ball, but only waist high, he miscues a pull shot through midwicket
play and miss, at a clever slower ball. 123kph, off spinner type slower ball, it beat the edge as he was driving too early at it. Well bowled
122kph another slower ball, wider, he thinks about cutting and bails out late
136kph, shorter length outside off, he's sitting back and defending with soft hands, running it to a gap at point
141kph, a yorker, a hint of tail, it's outside off, Wade jams the bat down to keep it out
89kph, drifting into middle, he reaches out to defend
89kph, looped up, outside off, he drives nicely to long off
86kph, nicely flighted on off, he defends on the front foot
clever reverse sweep off the top edge and it runs fine! Deliberate shot, probably didn't want to get it that fine and in air but he got the result
fuller on leg, he defends with the spin to midwicket
attempted reverse sweep, extra bounce, it comes off the glove but balloons safely away from Rizwan and they get an easy single
off stump line, forward defence
watches it go by
stopped on him a little bit. Went at the drive too early. Quick single too, and Wade gets copped on the hand by the throw. That'll sting
fuller length, driven straight back
blocked on the offside. Labuschagne wanted a single, and made a comically exaggerated point about it to Wade. Wade was neither amused nor inclined, it appears
solid defence to end the over
harmless full delivery. Wade blocks
down the crease, and a single to mid-off
opens his body and drives down to long-off
flighted, blocked
down the ground, Haris drags his length back

and Wade nicks off to Rizwan! He looked to open the face and run it down to third man. The edge ended up being a little too fine, and even Rizwan appeared surprised to find the ball in his gloves. Soft dismissal, but Pakistan will take it!
off stump line, left alone
flicked towards fine leg. Sharp running from the duo, and Labuschagne moves to 146
in the air, perilously so for a moment it seemed. Opened the face of the bat and went over cover. Was in a gap in the end, but unconvincing from the batsman for once
worked away to the onside, and Head is off the mark
driven to mid-on
tucked away to fine leg. 5 from an eventful over
cut away to third man
short of a length, defended to midwicket
flicked to midwicket again
fuller, and that runs away. Bit fortuitous, that; he was looking to crack it through the covers. But Haris pays the price for going too full, reducing his own margin for error
defended
worked down to square leg, and Head keeps the strike
swivels and hoicks it to the onside, and they come back for two
looking to exploit the footmarks by going wider of off stump. Head watchfully leaves
wonderful batting. Ever so slightly short and Head pounces on this to send it racing past point
tucked down to fine leg. They think about a run, and think better of it
defended
keeps the strike again. The runs coming freely now
driven back

thick outside edge on a fuller delivery again. Rizwan the man who has the chase ahead of him, and dives on the boundary to prevent arun. Brilliant work from the wicketkeeper. That's the lunge of a man newly into the team!
stroked to point, and that's 150 for Labuschagne. Wonderful innings, and he's very quickly become one of the first names on the team sheet for the home side. Looking supremely comfortable
landed on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
tucked to square leg
driven back
sloppy from Yasir. It was driven straight back to him but goes through his fingers
round the wicket, Yasir lands it on leg stump, and he reverse sweeps it to third man. Partnership absolutely racing along in no time
short of a length, worked to fine leg
worked down to long-on
tucked away to the onside
too full outside off stump, and Head pierces the gap between mid on and wide extra cover. He's come in looking like as settled as the man on 150
defended
dropped into the onside, and Yasir forced to chase it. Meanwhile, Australia run two and bring up the 500
fuller length, driven back
wristily worked across to long-on
driven to mid-off
three from that over
starts off with a length delivery, to which he moves back and offers a straight defensive bat
wide of off stump, carved away to point
driven smartly down the ground
angled across, and Head lets it go
opens the face and drives to cover
tucked into the onside
driven through the offside
defended
tossed up, Head comes down the crease, only to dead-bat it
went for an expansive drive. No timing, though

gone! Haris has another one!. Absolutely superb catch, too. Anticipates the shot as Haris throws one outside leg stump. Head was looking to tickle it to fine leg and Rizwan moved across to pouch it sharply. Brilliant stuff from the keeper after 140 overs.
good ball first up. landed on leg and spinning away. Paine, for his part, confidently flicks it to midwicket
short of a length. Labuschagne moves back and strokes it to the onside
got into position early for the pull shot and fine leg had to be sharp to keep it to one. He wasn't, and they come back for two
driven to mid-off
run it to point and thought about a run, but Babar was sharp enough to dissuade Labuschagne
defended
fuller, driven to mid-on. Two off the over
middle stump line, Paine blocks
guided down to square leg, and Paine is off the mark
drives to mid-on and scampers through, taking on Shan Masood's arm. Good running from Australia
excellent delivery. Slid it through, pushed Paine well back in his crease to block
strays down legside with this one
too short, and Paine makes room to cut away to point, and despite a diving effort from the fielder, keeps the strike
around the wicket, solid back foot defence from Paine
drags this down and these are easy runs for the Aussies. Paine moves away and carves it through cover
tucked away to the onside
opens the face of the bat, but couldn't quite beat extra cover
driven back to the bowler
five off that over, taking Australia's lead to 276
fuller, driven down to long-off
driven back to the bowler
glorious shot, nearly went all the way. Came dancing down the track and effortlessly lofted it over cow corner, which was completely empty. Far too easy for Labuschagne right now
another boundary, this time using the pace of the ball to play it late, running it down to the third man boundary
leading edge, didn't time it for once. Was in the air, and short cover would have been in business
top edges a sweep which goes over the keeper and first slip. 14 off that over
didn't quite time that, thick inside edge to the onside
run down to long on
flicked away to midwicket
another easy single to long-on
down the wicket, straight to the cover fielder

big appeal, this might be interesting. Labuschagne went for an expansive sweep and missed it altogether. Was fairly straight, but they decide against a review. Looked like it was missing leg, to be fair
defended
driven back to the bowler
tried to get a quick single but Rizwan sprints across to ensure he cuts it off
fuller length, and Paine drives back to Haris
blocked
defended, and that is tea!
135kph, full yorker, fourth stump line, it squeezes under the bat but it's wide of off
too full angled into off, he clips this beautifully with the angle between midwicket and mid on! Lovely placement. Threaded the gap superbly
And again! This whipped square of midwicket. Again too full and straight and he timed it beautifully. Lovely balance. Two gifts
good length, fourth stump, he defends on the front foot
138kph, shorter length, wide of off, he sits back and late cuts nicely but straight to gully on the bounce
139kph, good length outside off, he steps out to it and works it with the angle wide of mid on for a single
shorter length, he's back and punching back to the bowler
shorter and slower, he's back and forcing this to long on
looped up, on off, nice drift, he steps forward and defends
pushed through on middle, he's back and defending
tossed up, outside off, some turn away from Paine, he leaves
drifting into leg, he defends on the front foot to short leg
139kph, wide yorker after Labuschagne set himself outside off early, it beats him as he jams down
140kph, another wide yorker, he squeezes it off the outside edge along the ground to wide slip
139kph, length ball, he stands tall and lofts this inside out over mid off, he mistimed it but got enough to get a couple
123kph, slower ball angled into middle, he clips this off the stumps to deep forward square

caught at second slip! Bottom edge trying to pull, onto thigh pad and it pops up to second slip! From around the wicket, not that short, back of a good length, he tried to pull and got cramped, got a little bottom edge, it hit the thigh pad and ballooned up to Asad Shafiq at second slip. Unfortunate way to go but it wasn't short enough to pull
121kph, slower ball, full outside off, he drives to mid off
skips down early, Yasir drags the length back, he's forced to defend
quicker ball drifting in, he defends on the front foot
slices a drive in the air but short of long off. He tried to work to the on side but sliced it against the turn towards long off
89kph, leg break outside off, he pushes away from his body to defend
shorter length, he stands up and pushes to mid on
wrong un, picked easily, he defends on the front foot
length ball wide of off, he tries to pull and misses. Nowhere near short enough for that shot

caught at gully! Soft way to go. Labuschagne lost all concentration there. Full and wide, it tailed away a touch, he reached out to play a nothing shot and just sliced it straight to gully. He remained at the crease for a while, just in disbelief at what he had done
140kph, yorker, tailing in, he drives and just gets the bat down
136kph, bouncer, outside off, he ducks and drops the hands low
137kph, back of a length, he stays leg side and cuts to gully on the bounce
139kph, yorker, tailing in, he jams the bat down and gets it back to the bowler
fuller on off, he drives with ease to a deep mid off
shorter wrong un, wide of off, he's back and cutting neatly through cover-point for an easy three
fuller leg break, a lovely stride out and he caresses this through cover, nice placement, three more

nearly bowled him! Brilliant bowling but it's four byes! Sharp spinning leg break, zipped back through the gate between bat and pad and bounced straight over middle stump! Rizwan missed it. Beaten by the turn as well
straighter on leg, he tickles this fine with control for a couple

Given lbw! Starc has reviewed. This looked plumb live. he went back to a leg break and got hit below the knee roll. Nothing on hot spot or RTS. No bat involved. Ball tracking has it pitching in line and smashing middle and leg. Australia lose a review. Good bowling from Yasir
141kph, shorter length, angled in, he's back and working this off the hip to fine leg
138kph, shorter length, top of off, he's back and defending
139kph, shorter on the hip, he works it with the angle to fine leg
124kph, slower ball, he drives neatly past cover, didn't time it perfectly and they get two
133kph, bouncer, high over the head and he ducks easily
134kph, shorter length outside off, he's back and trying to cut but chops a bottom edge
glorious late cut! Too short but not that wide, he was back and getting on top of the bounce, to cut late fine of third man. It races away
88kph, looped up outside off, he defends on the front foot
fuller and he defends on the front foot
ripping leg break, beats the outside edge as he defends
wrong un, fuller, he drives back to the bowler
shorter length, spinning away, he lets this go
good length, on off, he defends from the crease
128kph, back of a length angled into off, he defends from the crease to point

caught behind! Superb catch from Rizwan! Very wide half volley, he thrashed at a square drive, got a little edge off the toe of the bat, Rizwan had to dive forward and to his right to pouch it and he got his gloves underneath it. He's been excellent behind the stumps
129kph, good length, on off, he's squared up chopping an inside edge to square leg
130kph, shorter length, down the leg side and he can't flick it fine
130kph, short ball, angled into leg, he swivels and hooks fine, hits it flat but it bounces short of Shaheen at fine leg
nicely shaped leg break on off, he pushes it back to the bowler
shorter length, he's back and defending
looped higher, he drives firmly back past Yasir and he misfields to allow a single
faster leg break, he's forward and defending
flighted spinning leg break, gets a little inside edge onto pad and it just drops down
fuller wrong un, he drives beautifully straight of mid off! What a great shot
131kph, short ball on off, he's gets the front knee up and plays a nice pull shot to deep square
beaten. Awkward attempt at a late cut to a 130kph, back of a length ball, just beat the inside edge
133kph, length ball wide of off, he throws the hands a back foot drive but hits it straight to cover
131kph, back of a length, wide of off, he tries another expansive back foot drive but he misses
130kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending to cover
128kph, short ball wide of off, he makes a late attempt to upper cut but misses
shorter length on leg, he's back and working this to square leg
tossed up and he sweeps powerfully over forward square! Superb stroke. He loves that shot and nailed it. He has a big smile on his face
tossed up outside off, he drives nicely to deep cover

Huge lbw appeal and given! Hazlewood reviews. Good length leg break, spinning back down the line, hit him on the shin but he did get a decent stride in. Nothing on hot spot or RTS. No bat involved. Ball tracking has it hitting the bails. It stays out. It was pitching in line, hitting in line, and hitting the bails. Umpire's call. Good decision
stings him with a brute of a first delivery. Above the thigh pad and he's hopping around in pain. This won't be easy
rears up from short of a length, Shan only too happy to watch this go past him
silky shot. On his pads, and he gets onto the front foot quickly to whip it through midwicket. Shan showing he won't be pinned back. For now, anyway
flicked off the hips again. This one was straying down leg side, and Shan gives it short shrift. Positive start
gets in line and blocks it back to Starc
goes back to the shorter stuff - and looks menacing again. Whizzes past the batsman's nostrils. Eventful first over
short ball, Azhar watches it past him
length ball this time, Azhar keeps it down. With short leg prowling, he needs to
dragged down legside, Azhar attempted to run it down. In the end, was slightly lucky he didn't get a tickle on its way to Paine
short again, and Azhar is off the mark with a single to third man
good leave. That wasn't far from off stump
wider this time and Shan lets it go. Tight first over from Cummins
peppers Azhar with the short ball first up. Straying down leg, though
fuller from Starc, and closer to off stump. Azhar lets Paine collect
carbon copy. Pakistan eager to see off the new ball for the second time in two innings
fuller and wider, and Azhar onto it in a flash. That was 148 kph, but Azhar's eyes lit up the moment he saw width. Leant into it and just used the pace of Starc to time it for four

brings it back in, clatters into his pads, given!. Azhar was very indecisive about reviewing, but does. Got some swing for the first time, and beat Azhar on the inside edge. Umpire's having a look now. Fair delivery, and no inside edge. It's Umpire's Call for hitting the stumps. That means Australia have their first wicket. Pakistan on the ropes
gets off the mark first ball. In the blockhole, and he deflects it to the offside
opened the face and played it late, sending Lyon on a bit of a chase. They scamper three
rocks back and punches it into the offside
driven into the offside
fuller outside off, driven to mid-off
pushes Haris on the back foot, defended
short ball to finish the over
good fielding on the square leg boundary. That was a majestic shot from Shan. Got on the back foot and eased the ball to the boundary, and looked like it was racing to the fence
fuller on off stump, tucked into the onside
plays it late again, and used the pace to guide it to the third man boundary. Intelligent batting.

and gone! Carbon copy of the dismissal in the first innings. Back of a length outside off stump. Haris could have let that go but prodded at it. The ball moved ever so slightly away from him, Taking the bat's outside edge and sending back the number three
well, that's an easy first delivery to get. Barely landed on the pitch, it was so far down legside. Paine had to dive exaggeratedly to prevent it going for five wides
elegant back foot punch to end another successful over for Starc
tight, wicket-to-wicket line from Hazlewood first up
length ball, Shan defends
just outside off stump, Shan lets it go
worked away to the onside. They consider a run, but decide against it. Would be just like Pakistan to lose a wicket to a run out before the end of play
carved towards backward point. Maiden to start off Hazlewood's spell
short of a length, Asad gets on top of it
lands it outside off. Asad shoulders arms
reached for it a little. Fuller outside off and Asad lulled into a drive. The ball cuts back in and keeps low

gone! That's irresistible bowling! There's little you can do about that. On off stump, seaming away with a bit of extra bounce. Asad wanted to dead-bat it. It took the outside edge and flew towards Steve Smith at third slip
good defence from Babar first up
wide of off, Babar leaves
rocked on the back foot and pulled it across. I may jinx it, but Shan does look assured
wider of the crease, defends
top of off, defended
hits him on the pads as he looks to work it away
thick outside edge, and slips were in business. Just short of Labuschagne at fourth slip in the end
tucked away into the onside, and Shan keeps the strike. Pretty sure Babar won't mind that
pulled away by Shan. A little casual by the fielder at fine leg, and Shan sees an opportunity to run three
wicket-to-wicket, Babar solid in defence
wide down leg side
lands it outside off, Babar wants nothing to do with it
gets in line behind the ball
well left. Doesn't need to play anything outside off stump, and looks like he won't
Shan doesn't shy away from the pull shot. Nearly hit it straight down mid-on's throat, but just about manages to get it wider
straighter, and Babar practices his defensive shot once more
good ball, just wobbling outside off. Babar knows exactly where his off stump is, so watches it through to Paine
wider, left alone again
beauty. Goes right through the gap between bat and pad, and if you can do that to Babar, you've bowled a peach. Whisker away from off stump, too
more assured from Babar in defence this time
nearly chopped on. Loose from Shan, but fortuitously manages to get it down to fine leg
flicked off the pad to fine leg. Hazlewood a little sloppy, and Babar takes him on and comes back for two
lovely shot to get off the mark. No one at mid-off, and the moment he had a slightly fuller ball, he timed it down the ground
good comeback. Right on off stump
left alone
nicely played. Opens the face of the blade and carves it through extra cover. They briefly considered running four
short, Babar gets on top and works it down to the onside
short again. For a change, Shan opts not to take it on
rides the bounce and guides the ball down to fine leg
good delivery, shaping away. Babar in line to block it
short and sharp. Babar ducks
and again. This one's a no-ball, though, as it's the third one over shoulder height this over
whipped away to square leg, and they come back for two
nicely worked away from middle stump
smartly onto the back foot as soon as Babar saw width. Beats the man at backward point to come back for three
full, driven back to the bowler
bit of width, cut to the man at backward point
tucked down to fine leg
left alone
off stump line, defended
tossed up, Shan offers a straight bat to it
lands it outside off, Shan watchfully leaves
bat pad. Muffled appeal
some drift and turn from Lyon. That'll encourage Australia overnight
blocked
length delivery, dead-batted
just outside off, and Babar sensibly decides against engaging with it
too full and Babar makes him pay. Nicely driven through the cover region and gives the fielders a bit of a workout
comes around the wicket, but goes down legside
gets behind the line and efends
worked towards midwicket. Sharp work by Cummins keeps it to one
drags it too short, and with three close-in fielders, Shan has a chance to ease the pressure by crunching one through the covers
nice line. Tossed up slightly on middle and off. Shan solid in defence
bug, big turn. Hit the surface and reared up. Little Shan could do there

unplayable stuff Beats the outside edge - or does it flick the edge? - and first slip dives forward to take the catch. The umpires go upstairs to have a closer look at this. The soft signal is not out. Replays show the ball hitting the ground. Not out
lands on middle stump, defended
excellent penultimate over from Lyon. Shan lucky to still be out there, in some respects
thick outside edge, and it goes through the gap between third slip and gully. Bit streaky, though Babar's good enough for that to have been intentional
wider outside off, left alone
well bowled. angling back in and Babar almost allowed it through the gap again. Thick inside edge prevents it from sneaking through into the stumps.
left alone. That is what Babar wants to do to the final two deliveries, if at all he can
driven to point. One ball to survive for Pakistan
solid in defence. That's the end of Day 3, and Australia's record of not being beaten at the Gabba since 1988 is all set to continue
around the wicket, drifting in, spinning away and some bounce, he leaves wide of off
88kph, fractionally short and wide, he's back giving room and cutting nicely through point for a couple
fuller, drifting into off, he defends with the full face pushing to mid on
89kph, pushed through on off, he's back and cutting bravely close to off stump, picks out backward point
lovely shape, dipping in, he defends from the crease
drifting in, on off, he defends off an inside edge onto pad and it drops down
137kph, fuller wide of off, a bit of wobble but he's able to leave comfortably
137kph, back of a length, nipping into Babar, it takes him on the thigh pad. Some movement off the seam
139kph, back of a length, over off, he's standing tall and defending nicely with the full face

inside edge chopped onto pad. 137kph, back of a length outside off, he wants to force with an angled bat through cover-point, the inside edge goes onto pad, it's fortunate it doesn't bobble near the stumps
137kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he can leave on length
139kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he defends off the back foot with his bat slightly outside his body

dropped at mid off by Burns! Almost a screamer! Shan skipped down and smoked a flat drive to mid off, Burns diving like Superman to his left got two hands to it but it bounced away. It was laced. He saved a run really
flatter and shorter and he's back to defend
fuller angled into middle, he works this with the spin square of midwicket, they get two
90kph shorter outside off, he stands tall and punches backward of point! Wow. Lovely shot. Timing was supreme
shorter on leg, he's back and working this off the hip through forward square, they push hard for two
looped up outside off, he reaches out and defends
137kph, good length, angled in but wide of off, he leaves this alone
136kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he's able to leave again

edged short of slip! Similar to his first innings dismissal. Good length and angled in, straightening, he's caught on the crease, he defends but has soft hands and the edge falls well short of Smith at second
138kph, fuller length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, it's close to cut, he mistimes it to backward point
141kph, good length, fourth stump line, he's back and across and defending in a compact position
135kph, good length, angled in, fourth stump, he defends from the crease
133kph, back of a length, fifth stump, he stands up and punches with a vertical bat to mid off
132kph, shorter and wider, Babar lays into a cut shot but he hits it straight to point
136kph back of a length, fourth stump, he's squared up in defence getting an edge along the ground to gully
beaten by a cracking delivery that seams away at 135kph. It was angled from wide of the crease, hit a crack and seamed away, missing the edge by a far way
beaten by another beauty! This was better, 135kph, same length, it climbs and rears away, he fends off the back foot but got nowhere near it. Babar is smiling. Can't nick those
he drives a length ball and slices it behind point! Wasn't in control but it was along the ground. He drove at a length ball wide, gets a thick outside edge and it runs away
140kph, fuller, fifth stump line, he leaves on the front foot
139kph, short ball, head high, he takes it on, swivelling on a pull and he controls it well, getting it wide of fine leg, Hazlewood is sliding on the rope to save it
141kph, good length wide of off, he leaves decisively
139kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
139kph, good length angled into off, he's half forward and defending
134kph, back of a length, angled into off he defends on the back foot
137kph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves
135kph, wide of the crease angled into off, he defends from the crease on the front foot
133kph, over-pitched, he controls a nice check drive past mid off, played under his eyes, didn't time it perfectly but gets a couple
pulled in the air but straight of midwicket! A shoulder high short ball on off, he stands tall and slaps it flat but in the gap through midwicket
135kph, good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave
140kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot, only half forward
beaten. Superb delivery. 140kph, angled across and climbing away, he shuffles back and across but it zips past the shoulder of the bat
139kph, fuller on off, he drives getting a thick inside edge onto pad and it runs to the gap at midwicket
140kph, fuller sixth stump line, he leaves this alone
140kph, back of a length, angled in to off, he's back and across and defending
140kph, good length, angled into off, he defends half forward, it runs off a thick edge along the ground to gully
138kph, fuller length, angled wide of off, he leaves this alone
135kph, good length, top of off, he defends off a thick inside edge that runs to midwicket and they pinch a single
134kph, fuller length on off, he drives on the up, a little uppishly, towards mid on
133kph, good length, fifth stump, he makes a late but good call to leave
133kph, good length wide of off, he leaves, and this dies a touch through to Paine
132kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends from the crease pushing away from his body
beaten by a brute! 139kph, pitching on middle, back of a length, it seams away and climbs from a length, he was squared up but did well to miss it. That was a serious delivery
leading edge falls well short of point. Again back of a length on middle, he closes the bat face trying to work to leg, the leading edge flies square to point but safe
141kph, good length, wider of off, he leaves this
141kph, bouncer, over middle, he ducks under it
137kph, back of a length on off, he is back and shovelling it with the bottom hand forward of square for one
142kph, back of a length, top of off, he defends from the crease with soft hands
135kph, steep bouncer, he shapes to pull but ducks instead
134kph, short ball, chest high, he swivels and plays an excellent controlled pull to deep square
136kph, fuller length, fifth stump line, he leaves this alone watchfully
135kph, fuller, he plays a glorious on drive but can't beat Starc. That was a picture from Babar. The sound off the bat was pure. You won't see a better shot for none
136kph, good length, stays a touch low, Babar is caught on the crease and jams the bat down in time
good length, 134kph, fourth stump, he's caught on the crease again squared up in defence to point
138kph, back of a length angled across, he raises the bat high to leave
good length, 140kph, angled across, fifth stump line, he leaves

caught behind! A little tickle trying to hook a bouncer! This was a very high bouncer over leg, Shan has been taking the hook shot on, he tried again but it was too high to get on top off, the ball brushed the top edge and flew through to Paine who took it above his head.
141kph, back of a length, fourth stump he defends nicely off the back foot
138kph, shorter length outside off, he's back and dropping the hands underneath it to let it go
138kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves as it seams away
135kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves
134kph, angled too straight, he clips this nicely off the pads through square leg to the sweeper

caught behind! Superb delivery! 132kph, on the money, perfect length, angled in from wider on the crease, it jags away off the seam, he has to play but he's caught on the crease, squared up, a little edge through to Paine and a simple catch for the skipper

137kph, back of a length, he chops an inside edge past leg stump! It was well wide of the stumps actually, but it was a good delivery, he was caught on the crease defending with an angled bat and gets a single
136kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
nagging line just outside off stump. Rizwan lets it go by
length delivery, Rizwan gets in line and defends
and again, Cummins just plugs away just outside off stump. It's that line and length that produced the wickets of Asad Shafiq and Iftikhar
goes short this time, ducked
good leave just outside off stump
comes wider of the crease to angle it back in. Solid defence. Excellent over from the world's best bowler
runs it down to third man
confident shot from Rizwan. Drives on the up. Straight to a fielder, but it may be an indication that he wants to play much the same way he did in the first innings
taps and gets swiftly off strike. Pakistan need Babar to face as much of these deliveries as possible
fuller on off stump. Hazlewood follows it up with a long stare down at Babar
good, sharp delivery. Jagging back into off stump from wider of the crease
bouncer to finish, Babar ducks
lands the first one just outside leg stump, Rizwan flicks it to midwicket
good bounce there. Grew big on Rizwan and he was struggling to keep it down for a moment. Nearly struck on the handle of the bat
length delivery this time, Rizwan blocks it back to the bowler
flicked off the glove. I thought it might have been running away, but very good work from Paine sees him move across and nearly pull off a brilliant catch with his left hand. That goes down as a drop
defended
maiden over. Australia applying the chokehold very effectively. Can see Rizwan getting frustrated if the runs don't start coming
just back of a length to start off, Babar goes back in his crease and drives
fuller this time, draws him out
nice length. Babar momentarily unsure about his footwork, but manages to block it convincingly enough
works this one down to fine leg, and the pair run a couple
good ball again. Turn and bounce, and Babar needs to be fully focussed to turn that away to the offside
driven back to the bowler. Probing first over from the offspinner
bit of width on offer. Rizwan looked like he really wanted to lash out at that with a square cut, but held himself back. This is what I meant by him getting frustrated
and pounces on this one. Fuller ball and Rizwan has the chance to lean into a cover drive. Hasn't quite timed it well enough to go all the way, but Warner had a chase to the boundary from extra cover
just back of a good length, and Babar dead-bats it
almost yorker length just outside off stump. The pace is up, too, just over 145 kph. Babar digs it out
very well directed bouncer. Babar got out of the way, but it almost kept coming back into him. Has to arc his body, almost into a C shape, to ensure it doesn't clatter him on the grill
tucks it around the corner, and keeps the strike. Bit loose, that, from Australia. They would have wanted Rizwan facing Lyon
blocked
tossed up, comes down the ground and drives it thorough the onside
pulls his line back slightly, pins Babar to his crease. Defended
sharp turn from outside off. Babar cuts it away to backward point, where a fielder lies in wait
this time he gets it away!. Gets it squarer of that same fielder, who puts in a valiant dive
goes back in his crease and defends
back of a length, defended to cover
driven down the ground, but that's sharp work at mid-off, who cuts the ball off and keeps it to one
back of a length, blocked
handcuffs him with a shorter delivery around the left armpit. Babar wanted to play a somewhat extravagant pull, but ended up just fending it away to midwicket
top of middle, and it takes Babar's outside edge. It's all along the ground through the slips, but that's a moral victory fro Starc
very good bouncer to finish the over
lands it just outside off, RIzwan blocks
bounce and turn, pushing Rizwan back in defence
blocked
gets behind it and defends to the offside again
and again. Patient stuff, both from bowler and batsman
thick inside edge, but he's kept it down
defended on off stump
targets that off stump line from a wide angle around the wicket
drags this one down leg side
back foot punch from Babar gives Lyon a chase from cover point. Babar moves to within four runs of his half-century
tucks it away to square leg
back of a length, Rizwan watches it go past
flicked to short leg. On the bounce, of course, or I'd be making a bigger deal of it
defended
skips down the ground and drives to long-on
dead-bats it. Rizwan has looked good in the past twenty minutes or so
uses his feet to work it down to long-on
keeps the strike after working it to square leg
wicket-to-wicket, Babar drives it back to Starc
and there it is. 50 for Babar Azam. Makes some amends for the poor shot selection in the first innings. Comes in fine style, too. Rocks back and just punches it through cover, sending it racing away
Starc bounces him in response
helped along to square leg
moves onto the front foot and carves this just behind square on the offside
very quickly spots the short length and goes back and absoutely spanks Starc to the midwicket boundary. That doesn't happen too often to Starc, and RIzwan may just have started loosening up
blocked
gets behind it and defends
flicked to short fine
wider of off stump, and Babar sees the opportunity to beat the man at extra cover with a nice drive. Not quite timed to perfection, and they run three
dances down the ground but drives it straight back
back of a length, and Rizwan slightly disappointed not to clear the man at short third
starts with one floated up around middle and off. Driven to the onside
on the money right away. lands on off stump and it bounces and turns away. Nearly took his outside edge
Babar decides to stamp his authority. Bit of flight and room and he crunches that past cover point. Babar doesn't want to let him settle
blocked
dragged down and Babar goes back and smacks him over mid-on. Nearly went all the way for six, that
defended. Interesting over, would like to see more of that
comes down the crease to try and smother the spin. Just about got to the pitch of it
stays back and blocks it to the offside
very sharp turn, but Rizwan still manages to slice it through the offside and get off strike
defended
worked away through the offside
lands on off stump, Rizwan blocks
tossed up. needs to be straighter. Babar runs it down to extra cover
strange shot. This was well outside off, too, and Rizwan was eager to lap-sweep it. When he saw it wasn't on, he swept it anyway, top-edging it, luckily for him into a gap
that's bang on the money. Lands on middle and spinning
slides this one through, Babar lets it go
wrong'un, cuts it away to deep point
decides to leave that alone. That's lunch
130kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends from the crease half forward
131kph, good length, nipping back, hits him on the thigh pad, there's a stifled appeal for lbw but it's way too high
131kph, back of a length top of off, he defends half forward taking the bottom hand off the bat to get it to square leg
fuller and wider, he slices a drive slightly in the air towards point, Lyon makes a good diving stop to know it down but they get one
131kph, good length, top of off, he stands tall and defends
133kph back of a length on off, he's defending on the back foot
134kph, good length, he drives on the up dragging it through forward square, wasn't in control but he gets off strike
134kph, back of a length wide of off, he plays a sumptuous back foot drive to cover's left and Labuschagne makes a sensational one handed diving save
136kph, good length but well wide of off, he leaves
cracking cut shot! 137kph, short and wide, a gift for Babar, so much time to rock back and smoke it forward of point
137kph, good length, sixth stump line, he leaves
136kph, slightly fuller and tighter to off, he defends half forward pushing this to point
133kph, back of a length fifth stump line, he stays leg side, opens the blade and runs this nicely past gully. It came off the slice of the bat but he controlled it ok
132kph, fuller, off stump, he presses forward and defends on the move, pushing it to mid off
132kph, good length fourth stump line, he defends from the crease, opening the face running it to gully along the ground
132kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he leaves this alone
137kph, back of a length, wide of off, he's happy to leave
133kph, angled in, straightening off the seam, he's squared up trying to press forward, the leading edge drops down
138kph, over-pitched, he plays a lovely drive straight back to the bowler
140kph, back of a length outside off, he's up on his toes and timing this beautifully with a back foot punch through cover-point. Didn't over hit. Lovely shot for three
nails a pull shot behind square! Good shot. 140kph, shoulder high angled into him, he swivelled and got on top of it, nailing the pull along the ground. No one is back
good length, top of off, he's pressing forward to defend off the inside half of the bat to midwicket
139kph, good length, he pushes on the front foot with soft hands to the gap at cover and calls decisively
wild bouncer. This was high and sprayed down leg, might have hit a crack actually, Paine couldn't get near it. Five wides
139kph, good length, angled into the top of middle and off, he defends from the crease

huge lbw appeal, given not out. The Australians deliberate and review. Height the issue here. Good length nipping back, it beat the inside edge and hit the top of the knee roll on the crease. There's nothing on hot spot or RTS. No bat. Umpire's call, with hawkeye having it clipping the bails! Everything was right but it was umpire's call. Babar survives. Australia keep the review. That was very tight
135kph, fuller, outside off, he drives nicely but can't beat Wade diving to his left
137kph, good length outside off, he defends with soft hands to cover and pinches a single
late cut sliced past gully! 138kph, back of a length, he plays a one-day style glide to third man, nicely done. Brave shot with the catchers there. But he executed
136kph, slightly fuller, he's pressing forward reaching away from his body, pushing it past backward point for a couple
135kph, back of a length, top of the stumps, he defends from the crease
138kph, back of a length, top of off, he's caught on the crease, defending without much footwork knocking it away
139kph, fuller angled into middle, he drives elegantly straight to mid on
139kph, good length, top of off, he defends neatly from the crease
142kph, very full, driven firmly to short mid on
142kph, bouncer, very high, he ducks under it easily
back of a length on off, he defends on the back foot to mid off
138kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he's back and chopping his down on the off side
133kph, good length, fifth stump line, easy leave for Rizwan
135kph, good length, angled into the top of off, he squirts this off the thick inside edge forward of square for a single
133kph, fuller and too straight and he glances neatly to fine leg
135kph, chest high bouncer, he pulls forward of square, not timed perfectly but hit well to deep square
short and wide and smacked! Superb. Bad ball from Hazlewood and Babar can play these in his sleep. He thrashes it to the cover-point rope
tossed up outside off, he skipping down and driving inside out through cover, good footwork but it's only one
shorter and wider, he rocks back and hammers it to point who is deep and they only get one
looped up outside off, he steps forward and defends under his eyes
flatter and quicker, he's back and defending
89kph, slightly shorter, he's back and cutting against the turn to the deepish point
straighter line, he reaches out and defends
134kph, short on the hip, he is back and tucking behind square neatly
135kph, back of a length, wide of off, he's back and neatly punching this with the vertical bat to deep point
137kph, shorter length, wide of off, he cuts firmly and straight to point
shorter length, on off, he stands tall and punches back to the bowler
137kph, bouncer, that took off and Paine has to leap up to take it
another fast bouncer, he tries to pull but misses, beaten by the excessive bounce
89kph tossed up on middle, he skips down nicely and drives to long on
tossed up, he's down the track and whipping to midwicket
89kph, short and fractionally wide, sensational footwork to get back and cut hard through cover-point! Excellent shot. Really great use of the crease
fuller outside off, he presses forward and defends
tossed higher, he leans out to smother it
flatter on off, he defends on the front foot
135kph, back of a length on off, he's fending awkwardly, taking the bottom hand off the bat, it comes off the inside shoulder of the blade and runs behind square
138kph, bouncer, angled well across
139kph, over-pitched on middle and leg, he clips this very nicely wide of mid on, well timed but it doesn't go all the way
139kph, shorter length wide of off, he stands tall and punches superbly past mid off, what a stroke, they get three more
beaten, 137kph, ball climbing across him as he fended at it away from his body
141kph, back of a length on middle, he defends from the crease back to the bowler who is frustrated and flings it at the stumps
pitching on leg, he reaches out to defend
fuller on leg, he plays from the crease, defend with soft hands
flatter and quicker on leg, he's back and working this around the corner to short fine
tossed up, he skips down and defends with bat and pad together
fractionally short, he's back in a flash and cracking this through cover! What a shot. That was such good footwork to create the length and then time it so well
good length on middle, he's forward to defend
140kph back of a length on leg, he's back and tucking this to forward square
upper cut over point! Great shot. Short and wide and angled across, he was jumping into this upper cut, lofting it high over backward point. Excellent option
138kph, shorter length, into the ribs, he jumps up again but has to knock this down
137kph, he misses an attempted upper cut. This was closer to him, harder to create the room, it just beat the top edge
139kph, bouncer over leg stump, he ducks under it easily
climbing short ball, 135kph, on off, he has to rise on his toes to knock it down
135kph short ball and it's met with a superb pull shot! Only chest high, he was back and waiting, rolling the wrists and thumping it forward of square
135kph, bouncer, much higher, he ducks under it
136kph, another sharp bouncer, he drops the knees and sways inside it, but watches it well
a sumptuous drive on the up to bring up a century! A second Test hundred for Babar! That was a world class shot to bring it up. Length ball wide of off, he caressed a drive on the up through cover!
fuller on off, he pushes on the front foot to mid on
138kph, nearly sneaks through. Full and swerving back he jams it off the inside edge onto pad
slog-swept. Didn't control that much at all but it's enough contact to take it to the fine leg boundary. That brings up his half-century
blocked
kept a little low
nicely defended

bouncer to Rizwan to kick off. He looks across again, hoping for a wide

cutting back in to Rizwan. Goes back and defends

block and run from Rizwan. They scamper through. Direct hit from Wade at short cover might have made it interesting

defended

driven back to the bowler

defended

defended

driven down the ground

eased to deep backward square

driven back to the bowler

blocked

solid in defence again. And that is tea
84kph, leg break from around the wicket, he stretches out to defend
full toss, he swipes this hard through midwicket to the sweeper
looped up wide of off, he drives wide of cover and takes a tight but comfortable enough single
leg break on leg, he defends with soft hands to cover-point for one
tossed up, he drives firmly, dragging it to a deep mid on
excellent sweep past short fine! It was pitched outside leg, fine leg is up and deep square back, he roped it powerfully behind square past short fine to the rope
advances and lofts this straight of mid on! Excellent footwork, skipping down and lofting straight of mid on. He didn't flush it but got enough of it
shorter outside off, he's back and knocking this to point
flatter on off, he defends to silly mid off
slog sweep over midwicket! Tossed up outside off, he reached out and slapped it flat over midwicket. The man back is behind square
shorter length, he's back and closing the face, gets a little leading edge but it drops down
flatter on middle, he defends from the crease
86kph. wide leg break, he drives powerfully to cover
quicker and flatter, wider of off, he leaves
tossed up on off, he drives firmly to long off
wrong un, he's back and punching this to cover-point
thick outside edge flies safely towards third man, he was square driving but not in control and it runs away for two
short and wide, he's back and hammering a cut to deep point
beaten by one that doesn't turn. It was tossed up wide of off, he played for turn and it went past the edge
shorter length, he's back and forcing through cover for a couple
skips down the track, and works it back to the bowler
flatter on off, he defends on the front foot to cover
fuller outside off, he drives nicely against the turn to the gap at cover
97kph, arm ball wide of off, he leaves
full on the pads, he flicks this beautifully off the legs behind square! Very attractive stroke from Yasir. Poor delivery but he put it away in fine style
133kph, back of a length, fifth stump, he's shuffling around poking at it away from the body to knock it down
135kph, fuller length, chipped in the air but safely short and wide of mid on
135kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot
134kph, fuller on off, he drives straight of mid on and runs with the stroke
139kph, full almost a yorker, on off, he digs it out
89kph, shorter length, he's back and punching this to long on
tossed slower on off, he pokes into the off side, wants one but is sent back
angled into middle, he defends on the front foot to midwicket
angled down leg, he tickles this fine, they could have pushed for two but they only run one

Has Labuschagne taken an extraordinary catch? Umpires send it upstairs. Soft signal is out! Rizwan went to paddle sweep, it popped up off the glove and went behind the keeper, Labuschagne ran from short leg, Smith from slip, they both dive and Labuschagne comes up with it. But the ball just touches the ground as he catches it in the one hand. Not out is the call from the third umpire.
shorter length, he's back and punching this through cover
135kph, bouncer, high over middle
137kph, back of a length on middle, he's working this with the angled forward of square
135kph, full on off, he drives nicely without a lot of timing, placing it straight of mid on for a single
beaten by a beauty, that seamed away wide of off, Paine took it and fired at the stumps as Yasir just walked back into his crease in time after wandering out
137kph, good length on off, he defends unconventionally, knocking it into the leg side
135kph, back of a length, on middle, he is back and working this to midwicket

Oh no! Holes out at deep backward point! Just got sucked into a trap. Short and wide outside off, he has played the upper cut well in this innings but there's a man placed at deep backward point and he hit it straight to him! Easy catch for Lyon
bouncer, 139kph, way down leg, Paine dives full stretch and gets it on the finger, it runs to fine leg for a bye
back of a length on off, he's back and hurried in defence
top edge over the keeper! 136kph, short ball, he tried to ride it and work it behind square, top edge flies high and safely over the keeper, Paine sprints back to dive and save four!
134kph, short ball, he clears the left leg and smears this wide of mid on! Wow! Yasir having some fun. that was smoked.
waft and miss at a 135kph, length ball wide of off. He shuffled around pre delivery and missed it by some way
142kph, knee high full toss, he whips this as hard as he can through midwicket! He swung hard and nailed it past short leg and it raced away
142kph, angled down leg, no swing, it runs off the pad fine for four leg byes!
141kph, good length, fourth stump line, he leaves
144kph, shorter length, into the ribs, he tried to work it to leg but got taken on the body
143kph, bouncer, he takes it on with a pull but it flies over the top edge and over the keeper! That took off! Four byes
148kph, rocket at off stump, he just jams the bat down and slices a thick edge along the ground to gully

leading edge caught at mid off! This was angled down leg, he tried to flick this off the pads over backward square, closed the face too soon, it balloons towards mid off and Wade runs across from a wide position to take the catch sliding on his knees
138kph, angled on the pads, he clips this one neatly to fine leg
135kph, short ball he tries to hammer a pull gets a thick top edge over the slips and it runs to third man for four!
beats him with a lovely delivery that zips away from a length
135kph, short into the ribs, he knocks it down off the gloves behind square
139kph, short into the body, Imran doesn't see it, he freezes, it hits his thigh pad and runs to fine leg but they don't run as it would have been a dead ball for not offering a shot
142kph, cracking bouncer, he tries to pull but misses and it flies through to the keeper
144kph, length ball into the thigh guard, it bounces off his thigh pad and Labuschagne takes it neatly
146kph, attempted yorker, but it's speared down leg
144kph, short ball, into the ribs he swipes a cross bat pull infront of square to one of the three men in the deep on the leg side
145kph, back of a length, it rears into the chest guard and bounces to short leg
145kph, fuller and angled across, he missed trying to drive with no footwork
131kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending to point, there's an easy single and they don't run. That was odd
136kph, bouncer, angled over off, the tall man drops to his knees and sways under it expertly
135kph, full and wide, he cleared the front leg and swung hard, but dragged it off the inside edge onto his body
caught at cover! 133kph, short ball, he swipes across the line with a wild heave, catches it high on the bat, it slices up to cover and Cummins moves across to take a simple catch
nearly bowled! 136kph, top of off, he backed away to try and hit it out of the stadium, he missed and it went over off
138kph, low full toss, tailing in, he bunts this to mid on
148kph, full and straight, he backs away and smashes a line drive over the bowlers head! Are you kidding!? What a shot. The best shot of his Test career! He nailed that

caught at long on! Australia win by an innings! 147kph, length ball, the field was back after that first shot, he swung hard and miscued it high towards long on, Wade had to wait a long time while underneath it but he takes it safely
